column1: During the period of falling in love

column3: despite his low speed to let me overtake.

Every time I imagine that someone I love or I could contact a serious illness

Same as in anger.
Friends who torture animals.

I experience a sense of guilt as my middle son cannot express himself like other children

When

column1: At the beginning of a new course

My disgust was directed at the gestures and facial expressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoying themselves.

column2: I felt ashamed as I had not mentioned it earlier.

column1: When I had not prepared my contribution to the group as thoroughly as the other members
column2: with the result that the overall result was poor.

column1: When my father and I worked on the house just after he had recovered from illness
column2: I was rather lazy. This meant that he had to work hard and was not very well later.

column2: despite the fact that he had more time to do it than I had.

column1: I got angry at my mother for something trivial. We were in a bad mood because my father was very ill and I knew that my mother really needed support. I had reacted wrongly.
On New Year's Eve 1983/1984

column3: questioned and then told to go. The situation ended happily since there were no consequences.

Due to laziness

column3: to some extent

When my sister had the stillborn child

Not applicable.
A couple of years ago during the summer holiday

column3: happiness and fulfilment. the whole of nature was full of music.

column1: I was alone at home
column2: in bed reading a women's magazine in which there were stories of paranormal experiences. My leg was itching and I stretched my hand to scratch and I felt another strange hand. (later I realized that it was the corner of the blanket).

column1: I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled
column2: this was the second time. One had a negative attitude towards the lecturer.

column1: In the tram
column2: there was a fat
column3: sickly-looking woman in front of me who was asking for directions in a thick voice. When she got up to go a disgusting smell of urine came from her. I felt that I would choke.

column1: When we were at home
column2: my husband and I
column3: made a remark about something I had done
column4: in a perfectly friendly manner. My deed had been unjust and I knew that my husband was right
column5: therefore my a sense of shame.

column1: I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude toward men

column3: the same evening

column1: I went to practice in Sweden during the summer
column2: and I was afraid that I would not do well.

column1: In the holiday cottage of our association

column1: My grandmother died suddenly last summer.
My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he could
column2: and once put me in a difficult situation after which I could not but detest him.

column1: Once I arrived two hours late at my workplace (a bank) and I was still feeling feeble and tired.

I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the vice-chairman of our student organisation. I was really surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt
column2: though behind it there was worry - how shall I succeed?

column1: Our tutorial group was soon to be divided
column2: and we got a list of names of freshmen
column3: out of which five were to be in my group. We read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar room. I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if I would succeed as a group leader.

column1: We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant. a Despite my not knowing why I was angry with my companion. I let him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.
My grandmother died
column2: and my mother called me one Sunday morning in the Autumn. The way my mother told me about it
column3: I hated her an at that moment. She sounded as if she had been waiting for the death of my grandmother. I had lost a person close to me. I felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late. I had not remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.

column1: At the underground station
column2: a drunkard came to speak to me. He tried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began to speak about me with his companion. I detested this dirty growling man.

column1: I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be done in groups of two. I was talking about it to my friends when I said something negative
column2: in too abrupt a manner
column3: concerning my work partner. I did not quite mean what I said and I felt ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also a friend of mine.

column1: I told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with our relationship. I knew that I was important to him but I wanted to be free. I saw that this was difficult for him but I remained firm and did not change my mind.

column2: and for the first time

column1: I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me

column1: After hearing about the death of my grandfather. At first
column2: I could not believe it

column1: In the evening
column2: while I was watching TV

At my temporary job

column1: I met a dear friend of mine after a long time. I expressed my feelings in our own usual way

column4: etc...

column2: my friend and me

column1: Two boys whom I know were telling me

column4: scorned and touched her. I got very angry and did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.

column3: feelings of loneliness
column4: hopelessness and disconsolation. I felt that I should find a friend

column1: Out of sheer curiosity
column2: I went to see a pornographic movie in Copenhagen. The room was full of men

column1: After having quarrelled unnecessarily and without any reason

column1: Forced to fill in a questionnaire.

When someone does something wrong it affects me negatively.

column1: Quarrel in the family.
When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone - loneliness drains me.

Emptied a bucket of water in a hospital.

When I get a hug from someone I love.

I was driving very fast on a small road and I met an oncoming car in a right-handed bend. The other driver was on his own side of the road and I had to skid out of it to avoid a collision. It was dark.
My car had been towed away by the traffic police because it had been wrongly parked. However
column2: the sign had been put up only after I had already parked.

column1: After an operation
column2: I had to stay in bed for a long time.

column1: I was forced to stay in the canteen and eat the food that I had not asked for but got it anyway.

By mistake

My 2-year-old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention
column2: I was responsible for her.

I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed
column2: so I was depressed at every menstruation.

column1: In a warm bus full of people
column2: someone vomited and the whole bus stank.

column1: I complained about a colleague's behaviour as she goes back on her word
column2: is often absent and is irresponsible. I found out that she was an alcoholic and was trying to fight against her addiction.

column2: she gave me the date in passing.

column1: When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult education course. We had not met for 2 years but had both thought a lot about each other. A wonderful experience.a
When I was cycling through the park late one night
column2: two people jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me. There was a shouting something at the same time.

column1: When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying Psychology because of its low status.
I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance. He was more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my point of view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.

column1: Got a terrible exam mark
column2: which I couldn't understand the reason for
column3: and trying to see a lecturer or tutor
column4: but being a given the runaround.

column1: Watching an old lady running up the street to catch her bus and missing
column2: reminded me of my own mother and how dreadful it would be to be her in the same situation.

column1: Coming home one night - my sister was home
column2: and had been drinking heavily and started picking arguments.

column1: When I am travelling by car and have to meet an oncoming car while overtaking.
When a close relative is treated badly.
When a close friend died.
When I saw all the starving people in Ethiopia on T.V. It felt awful to see such suffering.
When a mistake occurred at work that I was not responsible for. This was disclosed later.
When I called my boyfriend he asked me if I would live with him.
Last Summer in Italy I was attacked by a dog. It was terrible to feel that untidy dirty dog against my naked skin.

When my father's new fiancee treats me like a child. She does not trust me and constantly misunderstands me. I get particularly angry when she says nasty things about my boyfriend with whom she works.
When the guy I was in love with told me that he had met someone else and that we would not meet again for a year. Although we did not have a steady relationship
column2: we were having an affair.

column1: When my love for a guy was returned.
When I think of death - not my own but that of my parents
column2: brothers and sisters.

column1: My parents did not approve of my choice of a boyfriend (now an ex-boyfriend). He happened to be 13 years older than me and he was considered completely unsuitable for me. IDIOT.
When my uncle comes (3 times a year) for the traditional Christmas dinner with my grandparents and other relatives and is very drunk.

I was living at home during the Summer vacations and towards the end decided to take some of my clothes and other belongings to an apartment in Guttenburg. When I had finished I went to my ex-boyfriend's (relationship uncertain) home and stayed there till 5 A.M. I had to leave then as my parents needed the car for work in the morning. My parents do not like my boyfriend.

I met my present boyfriend on a boat trip to England. We had said that we would call each other when we got back to Sweden (we were not going to the same town in England). As soon as I walked in he called from England as he could not wait till he came a home.
When my mother's heart nearly stopped.
There was a sofa in my flat which belonged to the old tenants who were acquaintances. It should have been picked up a year ago but they had postponed it. Eventually
column2: they decided on one date and I stayed at home despite the fact that I had other things to do. They did not come
column3: nor did they call and they still have not gotten in touch with me.

column1: When my ex-boyfriend and I separated.
Very intoxicated men who incite each other to fight.  I met a vile-smelling man on the tram who got closer and closer to me till I got up
column2: and then he got angry.

column1: Do not remember any situation of that kind.
When my nephew asked me to tell him a story and I simply did not have the energy or the will. When I saw his disappointment I was terribly guilty and read a story to him after all.
When I fell in love.
Earlier
column2: I was afraid of speaking in front of a crowd of people.

column1: A girl I was with went off with another guy.
At set-backs.
I worked in a harbour and emptied latrine containers from the back of the lorries.
The day after the night I drank too much at a party.
Can not think of anything.
When I was accepted as a student of Psychology here at Guttenberg.

I woke up in the middle of the night as I jumped and shouted with fear. I thought that someone's cold hand or something similar had touched my hand. I crept down under the covers and went back to sleep.
When I was a young teenager (14) my brother-in-law to be had made heavy advances on me. I did not understand very well what it was all about but I reacted strongly and the feelings are still there.
I broke off with my partner as I wanted him as a friend and not as a lover. He reacted very violently and I felt guilty as I had made him so desperately unhappy.
I made dinner for some friends and they appreciated it very much.
I was nearly knocked down while I was cycling.
My father and I had an argument because I do not help enough at a home.
I had intercourse with someone and then I realized that what I had done was wrong and it disgusted me.
Do not know.
I said nasty things which I did not mean to a friend.
After intercourse.
Disappointment over a friend.
Quarrelled with my younger brother.
When I woke up after a nightmare.
Helping older people on the toilet.
Can not think of anything.
Squeezed the puppy in the door.
When I was notified that I had been accepted as a Psychology student.

Motor failure on a boat outside Gothenburg when we were in heavy seas and the wind was strong. As we could not steer the boat we drifted towards the rocks. We did not succeed in attracting the attention of any passerby until 4 hours had elapsed.
A lady I live with had not bothered to clean up before she went on holiday (I live in a collective).
When I heard that a good friend had committed suicide.
I was present when they found a shopkeeper dead in his shop. a He had been shot with a shotgun at close range.
I do not remember when I last felt ashamed. I do not usually feel ashamed of what I do.
My mother accused me of not visiting her enough when she was in a hospital for an eye operation.
After I had made my debut at Ullevi against IFK
column2: Gothenburg and a got a good write-up in the paper.

column1: When I was 7-8 years old
column2: I woke up one night and found myself alone at home. My mother had gone out to buy cigarettes from a machine.

column1: As an evening class teacher

column1: A boy who shot dead a squirrel.

When I was involved in a car accident last November
column2: after the first fall of snow. I lost control of the car and it spun around and landed on the opposite side of the road
column3: on the hard shoulder. It was stopped by a pole on top of a bank sloping down to a stream.

column1: With the job appointments committee when the headmaster in charge explained that a male teacher was more suitable for a particular post. I had more years of service than the male teacher
column2: but this was not taken into consideration. I could have been given a less attractive job if things had gone the way the headmaster wanted.

column3: suddenly

There is a certain person

column1: When my grandmother died.
I overreacted towards my mother and felt ashamed afterwards.

My nephew is a deaf and also hyperactive boy. I had been responsible for looking after him for a full day and was very tired. Then he suddenly grabbed a knife and stabbed me in the leg. I got so angry that I didn't feel any pain.
A woman I know is slowly dying from cancer. Observing this process makes me sad.
Close friends talking badly of other friends.
My father died after two very painful weeks in bed. I felt relieved and ashamed of that.
We had a day off from school. Instead of helping my mother with her job

Fearing the use of power or reprimands when I belong to the minority.

column2: but later a used that agreement as a reason for attacking me.

column1: Receiving a postcard from my sweetheart who was abroad on a vacation

column1: Doesn't apply.

Doesn't apply.

Can't remember having had this feeling.
Can't remember that feeling.

Before important sports events.

column1: When I caused needless anxiety to a person close to me because of my lack of self-insight.
I was coming home from an exam and I supposed that I had passed it so I ran to a restaurant for a beer.
I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o'clock) had a date with my fiancee. We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.

My fiancee and I were at my parent's place watching TV. There were only two TV chairs and we were sitting on them when my drunken brother came in and rudely chased my fiancee off the chair she was sitting on.
I had drunk a couple of beers and my fiancee got angry at me.
We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby started coughing and spitting into his plate.
We got into a fight with some chaps in front of our family house. The value of the property destroyed was approximately 15 000 FIM. I felt ashamed when my parents came to know about this.

We had had a party the night before and we still had some liquor a left the morning after. I went to the kitchen pretending to prepare some tea and was caught by my fiancee pouring some rum a down my throat.
While dancing in a restaurant last week.
I was on the Inter Rail in Naples alone. After an evening in a restaurant
column2: I was going back to the hotel when a prostitute approached me to sell herself. I refused but as I carried on walking I felt that I was being followed by someone.

column1: When a girl left me.
I was on my way back from the Inter Rail
column2: on board the ferry from Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final journey within four days.

column1: On Reperbahn
column2: in a restaurant

column3: and when the bill came I could not pay the bill.

column2: waiting for my turn to come.

In the army

column1: A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear. a He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted when he told me that.
In a restaurant
column2: I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him a that he always repeated the same things. Sometime later I heard that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.

column1: After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own house but the house of people I hardly knew.
On our way to France
column2: my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for the dress rehearsal of Aida. It was a different world for us full of fascination. After the representation
column3: we ate a fantastic pizza in a restaurant near the Arena.

column1: On a mountain tour
column2: my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near the house
column3: there was a big dog who began to follow us. As my girlfriend is afraid of dogs
column4: I had to draw his attention to me. a He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I really did not like that.

column1: I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry a clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.
I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies. This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departure are always very depressing.
When I stayed at the house of friends
column2: I washed my face and wanted to dry it with a towel. This towel seemed to have been used for a long time already. It smelled indefinably awful.

column1: A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore
column2: once I stayed with him and his girlfriend
column3: I bought some meat
column4: but nobody wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said I thought you wanted to invite us for dinner. Of course
column5: I said
column6: but I thought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought it.

column1: It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl but I considered it only as an affair. Only much later I realized how painful this must have been for the girl.
When I was informed that a short story I had written had been accepted for publication.

Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and prevent the accident.
I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had caused. A third person meddled in our conversation and turned my efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had intended.
Death of my grandmother.
In school
column2: I had difficulties with mathematics. When I had to work for an examination
column3: I really felt disgusted.

column1: I played in a stage play. Suddenly
column2: in front of 200 people
column3: I could not remember the words I had to say.

column1: One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had a bad conscience and felt guilty.
After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.
One evening
column2: in the tramway
column3: I was afraid of two drunk men molesting my girlfriend and me.

column2: a local custom called star singing. One of the girls
column3: my girlfriend
column4: broke the star. Being the accompanying person
column5: I felt very angry thinking of the consequences.

column1: When the grandmother of my friend died in a hospital. My friend was crying and I was sad
column2: too.

column1: I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of his mouth while speaking.
It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something
column2: but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I felt ashamed and blushed.

column1: My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).
I went shopping with my parents - my father paid for everything for me
column2: I was very glad.

column1: When I was a child
column2: I heard the floor cracking and I thought there was a burglar in our house
column3: I hid under the blanket and trembled.

column1: During a lecture
column2: a colleague who did not know anything about the subject got on my nerves by asking silly questions.

column1: When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss them.
During a football game
column2: another player who was perspiring very strongly ran into me.

column1: I tried to pass an examination particularly well
column2: but I did it worse than ever. I felt ashamed.

column1: During my military service
column2: I lost a part of my equipment
column3: I accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.

column4: security etc.

column3: I was afraid and said that I could not ask.

column1: During the Christmas holidays
column2: I wanted to invite my brother
column3: his girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come to my place for dinner
column4: she refused and never mentioned it again as if I had never asked her.

column1: Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heard about it
column2: I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myself to it.

column1: I read a book about the situation in South Africa
column2: about the terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the white population.

column1: My P.T. instructor also works as a masseur. He wanted to massage me
column2: therefore I had to undress. For the first few times
column3: this was not easy for me
column4: I got gradually used to it.

column1: Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the theoretical questions very well
column2: but I failed the practical driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.

column1: When my brother came back home after staying in the hospital. He had undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death. When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after many weeks.
After a short stay in Marocco
column2: we missed the ferry boat back to Spain and we had to look for accommodation. By chance
column3: we met a man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being robbed in Marocco.

column1: After an exhausting day
column2: I came home and wanted to take a bath to relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had finished after an hour
column3: there was no hot water left for me.

column1: I met some nice people during my holidays. When they left I knew that I would never see them again.

A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in a front of her child. She left it to happen without saying a word in order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to calm the man
column2: but without success. Just because he was stronger we had to comply. From that day I detested him.

column1: For a medical check-up
column2: we - boys and girls - had to take off our clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and staring at us.

column1: I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way. a My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water
column2: slapped my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.

column1: One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.
I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was night and I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure
column2: nervous and overstrained.

column1: My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.
When my uncle died whom I had loved very much. I was very sad and an I felt totally helpless.
I watched the news on the TV
column2: it was a commentary about Hainburg. I felt disgusted when I heard members of the union speak about the situation.

column1: I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.
I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend
column2: I said things which I could have said in a more friendly way. After that
column3: I felt guilty.

column1: A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once she had a child she had a better relationship with them.
Once our school class went skiing. On a steep slope
column2: a boy standing behind me lost his balance
column3: fell down and drew me with him. I slid down the whole slope. At about 1 m distance from a tree
column4: I could stop.

column1: It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about young people just because I had not immediately left my seat for them.
When I was younger I was very good at apparatus gymnastics. I am always won competitions
column2: but once I was only in fourth place.

column1: A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.
Some men were talking about me and my sister.
During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain hopes in him. After a while
column2: I had to explain to him the circumstances

column1: I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I had not seen for two years.
I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house. an I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.
At the end of my holiday job
column2: I got less money than was due to me and nobody mentioned anything about that.

column1: My little cat which I had raised all by myself
column2: hanged itself when playing in the garden.

column1: At school
column2: a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the wrong things so he had to repeat a year.

column1: When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her feel hurt.
I had promised my friend to take her to an important appointment but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a well-paid holiday job.
I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our 11-month jubilee
column2: I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red rose.

column1: When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I came a home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited until somebody passed by.

I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her boyfriend.
When I was a child I had a grass parakeet I liked very much. His legs were crippled so he could not move very fast. Once I came into the room
column2: did not notice him and stepped on him. A few days later he died.

column1: When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of the night and shouted at me.
At school
column2: I was bad at mathematics. Although my teacher had admonished me to do my homework
column3: one day I had forgotten to do it. When my teacher noticed it
column4: I blushed and was ashamed to be rebuked in front of the other pupils. a

column1: When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried and shouted so my mother came in and scolded me.
After a weekend at a seminar
column2: I saw my husband again. I hurried home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling his body.

column1: One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground floor
column2: I was often afraid of burglars.

column1: One day
column2: when riding on a bicycle path
column3: a car coming from the opposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I had a priority.

column1: My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.
One day
column2: when I was twelve years old
column3: my brother took some slimy substance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made of cider and threatened to throw it at me.

column1: When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had told him that my father had retired.
I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I had wanted to.
A party with friends on New Year's Eve.
When I was hitch-hiking and I went with a man who drove like a madman.
I was in Hainburg in December and I was angry about the politicians and the police.
I met again a very good friend after a year and realized that there had grown a certain distance between us.
When I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the power of money.
When my grandmother died - at her funeral.
I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrel which was filled with the blood of pigs.
I went for a walk with a very close friend
column2: we were talking about our problems
column3: and I told her lies.

column1: I had to tell a colleague the time for an appointment with another colleague. I told her the wrong time - it was obviously my fault.
I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay
column2: my father took his purse and paid.

column1: My mother had fallen down a ladder when she had been gathering cherries. Her back was hurt. Just when I arrived
column2: I saw a person from the life-saving service giving her medical care.

column1: I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking place because I wanted to park my car there. Because of incoming traffic
column2: I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed his car on the place.

column1: My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.
At a discussion
column2: a friend took a fascistic view
column3: which I had not expected.

column2: my trousers suddenly burst
column3: therefore I was prevented from participating in several activities.

column1: When I was driving my motorbike I went into a bend incautiously and fell down. I was slightly hurt

column1: Before Christmas

column1: When I was a child
column2: I fell into a cellar (when playing) and could be freed only with big difficulties.

column1: I was angry about several drivers who showed aggressive and dangerous driving habits.
When my grandmother died. I had a very deep relationship with her (I lived with her for several years).
Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action on my part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusing she did not give up for a longer time.
When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men and women.
When I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped into another car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of the other car was very angry and I let him insult me because I felt guilty.
A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and invited me to a party.
When I was walking on the street
column2: a group of drunk
column3: bawling young people approached.

column1: When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would have liked
column2: too
column3: because he heaped a flood of words on the letter.

column1: When my grandmother died.
When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught me with them in my bag.
When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for a hours. She was in a good mood.
When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year
column2: as I'd just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired
column3: looking like a mess
column4: and nervous.

column1: When I wanted to talk to someone I liked and whom I have been told likes me (by his brother and even by himself) however he avoids any confrontation and is vague.
After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of support and made me laugh
column2: found myself alone for days on end.

column1: When a boy continued to use foul language and swear in a front of a group of my friends.
When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.
Feel guilty after greed
column2: buying chocolate and pigging out to the point of feeling sick
column3: especially as I am fat.

column1: When planning to marry.
No really strong such emotion. Just falling asleep when I caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow beside me.
My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in a recent broken relationship.
The recent break-up of a serious long-term relationship was helped along by would-be in-laws.
No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by her dancing instructor - he is a user
column2: i.e.
column3: takes advantage of her good nature.

column1: After failing a second attempt at Med 4
column2: following several difficult personal circumstances.

column1: Failure to complete the medical course as a result of failing fourth a year twice.
When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced as our guardians at their wedding.
A car accident nearly occurred between us and a drunk driver coming in opposite direction it missed us by approx 1 m and collided (after rolling twice midair) into nearby scrub.
When my boyfriend lied to me.
When my boyfriend took me to his father's grave.
On a boat trip - saw a mother giving a young child (approx 6-7 years) cigarettes.
When harassed by this boy - it was sexual (refer to GUILT).
When in grade 3
column2: late home from school every day for weeks a because of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to my mother about why I was home late.

column1: Getting a part-time job.
Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of us started zig-zagging and so did we. The car in front did a 180¬¶ turn we followed and ended up in a gully.
People hunting animals.
When my grandfather was sick and died I felt sad
column2: though
column3: when he was sick.

column1: People spitting in railway stations.
Falling over.
Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.
When my last year's second-semester results came through - I was ecstatic.
I was sleeping in my room but woke in the middle of the night to think I could hear noises and see shadows moving. I felt that someone was in the house.
At school
column2: a couple of years ago
column3: a so-called acquaintance told lies about me to a teacher I was told about it by friends who overheard the conversation.

column2: but it didn't save him from himself. It was an unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't jailed.

column2: I was responsible for sections with several employers

column4: saying that I was incompetent.

column2: and the attacked person bleed too much.

column1: At a party of friends
column2: I got completely drunk.

column2: I was playing football with my cousin and an in a certain quick the ball went on uncontrolled putting down a birdcage and killing it.

column1: When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job
column2: a boyfriend
column3: etc. A specific situation
column4: was when I started to date a boy whom I liked for a long time.

column1: When I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.
When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked
column2: a because there were persons that didn't have problems
column3: and wouldn't miss the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

column1: I felt very sad when I had to give up something that my right was mine and although I didn't get it
column2: a kind of souvenir that people don't give you the right to have.

column1: The acts of brutal violence generally disgust me. Fights
column2: physical aggression
column3: etc.
