When I was in reproved eighth grade of high school.
When I talked with a teacher yesterday who
column2: to say the least
column3: was rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.

column1: The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.
In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after the sexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.
When I wanted to kiss a friend and didn't succeed
column2: I felt shame.

column1: In a telephone talk where I was aggressive and stupid without the least
column2: reason or better motive.

column1: When I succeed in writing something I felt and did it I felt well and very happy for being able to express to myself something that was suffocating me.
When I crashed my car.
When in a difficult moment I couldn't express myself correctly and my thought came out with distortions bringing about highly negative and distorted results.
When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I was not present either to see the person or to try to share my emotions with other friends.
When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide how she hated herself for not having the willpower to get out of such a situation because it was convenient
column2: according to what she told me.

column1: When somebody suddenly said something (about me) at the wrong moment and I didn't agree (at that exact moment I was needing and an extremely positive word).
When my mother surprised me while masturbating.
I forgot to water the flowers in our flat and was rebuked by my friends who share the flat with me.
After my final examination at school
column2: I was glad that the examination was over and that I had passed it.

column1: When I was a child
column2: I had a nightmare. At that time
column3: I was not yet able to tell anybody about it
column4: so I was very frightened. I could not explain all that and I had to deal with it by myself.

column1: I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball and offended her relatives.
When my grandfather died. When I heard about his death
column2: I had a bad feeling in my stomach and I felt as if I had lost something very precious.

column1: My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.
Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite nonsense.
I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was for her to do it.
For about one year I had a rather bad relationship with my father. a Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay with him and I was very glad about it. It was a fine evening.
I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went home from the bus stop alone. It was dark
column2: I had to go through a forest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was very frightened.

column1: My sister had promised to help me to do translation English into German. But the day I needed her she told me that she was busy - I was very angry.
Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long time
column2: but nevertheless
column3: her death came unexpectedly. I did not and an I still do not want to believe that it is true.

column1: I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood
column2: I saw the body of a slow worm (without the head).

column1: I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would never have said normally. The next morning I was terribly ashamed about what I had said.
An accident happened to my little cousin because I had not taken enough care of her. She fell on the floor and her hands hurt.
I had a little cat who was very sick. As I liked it very much I went to a veterinarian with it. He told me how to tend it and it really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved a life.
When I was a child
column2: I had a terrible nightmare about St. Nicholas' a Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and the light had to be left turned on.

column1: As I usually do not start learning until a short time before an examination
column2: I once made up my mind to try to work for a long time. But once again I did not do it - and got a bad mark.

column1: A friend told me about his cousin who is my girlfriend. He said she had treated him in a mean and nasty way. I was surprised because
column2: in front of other people
column3: she had always treated him in a friendly way. I am very sad about it.

column1: I went out with my sister
column2: her boyfriend and his friend. I did not like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissed me. He was very strong so I could not defend myself.

column1: During the oral part of my final examination
column2: I made a mistake in speaking so all the teachers laughed at me.

column1: There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my mother. So my mother always scolded her.
When I passed my final examination at school.
When I was on a cave excursion with friends
column2: I suddenly lost them and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.

column1: When I felt being treated unjustly by a teacher.
When my grandmother died
column2: I had a stronger relationship with her than with my mother.

column1: When I was molested by an old drunk man.
When I had a Latin examination in school.
When I had drunk too much and nearly got alcohol poisoning.
When I met my girlfriend again in another town after a long separation.
When I went home alone early in the morning
column2: I had to go through a wood.

column1: A friend was unpunctual
column2: we wanted to prepare ourselves for an examination.

column1: When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.
At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered
column2: blood was dripping on the floor.

column1: In school
column2: I was very bad at running long distances and my classmates laughed at me for this reason.

column1: I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend I did not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurt while he was playing.
On my birthday
column2: an old friend of mine sent me a card. I had not met him for a year and I was very glad that he had thought of me.

column1: Once I spent a night with a friend at secondary school. We told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny noises. I was terribly frightened.
When we still attended school
column2: my brother and I usually went to see our aunt and show her our term report. She rewarded us with money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's
column3: he got more money.

column1: My friend was pregnant but lost her child during the second month. I went to see her at the hospital - she was crying. I felt very sorry for her.
When I attended school
column2: our class visited an institution for mentally and physically handicapped persons. Although I tried to control my feelings
column3: I was disgusted.

column1: After a party
column2: I spent the night with a friend. We both were drunk
column3: the morning was disillusioning. A friend was leaving the room and I felt shabby and immoral.

column1: I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt guilty.
A very good friend of mine had been away for three months. When we met again
column2: we ran up to each other and embraced.

column1: One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence
column2: I took an empty bottle with me.

column1: I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. He threatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.
When my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All people stood around the open grave and cried.
At a party
column2: I met a girl who drew me to her
column3: told me some nonsense and always wanted to kiss me.

column1: I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.
My uncle had promised to buy me a bicycle. As time went by and I had not received it yet
column2: I asked my father to buy it for me. Later I heard that my uncle had wanted to offer me the bicycle on my birthday two weeks later.

column1: Several days after my final examination at school
column2: I was sitting in an aeroplane on my way to Greece. I enjoyed that moment very much.

column1: One night I was lying in my bed awake but I had my eyes closed. I saw figures with terrible faces and black frocks bending over me and touching me. I opened my eyes but I could still see them. I had the feeling that somebody was in the room. It was terrible. Only when I turned on the light I was able to go to sleep.

I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car. a We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for me to go to Carinthia.
Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the hunter who shot him.

I was sitting in a station hall and watching a lavatory attendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something out of a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then she took some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and ate them. I had to leave - I felt like vomiting.
I had to go to the doctor because of venereal disease. I told the doctor that I must have been infected by my boyfriend. This was not true
column2: but I was ashamed
column3: to tell the truth.

column1: When we were playing
column2: I hurt my little sister
column3: but towards my mother
column4: I did not admit that it was my fault.

column1: My neighbour was not able to set his car in motion because it had snowed heavily. I helped him - he was thankful and invited me.
I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not want to be left behind
column2: so I braced myself and followed them.

column1: At an examination
column2: I got a bad mark just because of a small mistake. When I went to the lector and wanted to talk about that
column3: he did not listen to me but sent me away.

column1: My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with the driver.
When I watched a report about El Salvador on TV
column2: I saw people who had been murdered by terrible methods.

column1: At a cross-country race
column2: I wanted to take a shortcut (which is not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had observed that.

column1: During a discussion
column2: I reacted very aggressively and so I made it impossible to continue discussing.

column1: On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a long time.
When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead of listening
column2: I become angry.

column1: When we were on holiday my girlfriend had to leave me after 4 weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I had a job there.
I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgusted when we had the dissecting course. I cannot understand why some people like this course.
Some time ago we had a tournament at our tennis club. For tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to win the game
column2: I defeated him extremely. This would not have been a necessity.

column1: I had a discussion with my girlfriend. After some time we started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said a that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Sometime later I apologized for that.
On New Year's Eve
column2: I went to a disco with friends. I amused myself and got to know many other people.

column1: I had to go to the dentist. When he touched my tooth with his drill
column2: I was terribly afraid of the pain I would feel at any moment.

column1: I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating when a friend called me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry because I was prevented from eating.
My sister
column2: whom I like very much
column3: asked me for a favour which I refused her for some flimsy reason. Sometime later I felt sorry for that and something like sadness.

column1: On my way to a concert
column2: I went with a man who tried to molest me. At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills me with disgust.

column1: I asked my friend to come with me to the disco because I wanted to be with a person I know well. But when I amused myself with others I let my friend sit alone
column2: although I had asked her to come.

column1: I called my little sister to make her pick up her toy from the floor. When she still refused after I had asked her for the fourth time
column2: we began to quarrel. At last
column3: the whole family was involved in this quarrel and trouble was brewing.

column1: I had a singing lesson
column2: but I was not very good. The last exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher seemed satisfied.

column1: A teacher wanted to instil a certain opinion and a certain behaviour into me
column2: which I refused. I was afraid when I saw him.

column1: A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expected his call impatiently but in vain.
Years ago on Christmas Eve
column2: I felt very sad because I realized for the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas a year ago.

column1: A man whom I like was drunk and tried to molest me.

It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefore was not able to join the conversation.
I was on a concert tour and therefore separated from my boyfriend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep
column2: but his feelings were. I felt guilty when he said I am not a radiator.

column1: On my 18th birthday
column2: I passed the driving test. I was glad because I had had to study very much because I had been lucky and because - as proof that it was really difficult - not everybody had passed the test.

column1: At about midnight
column2: I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the whole
column3: it was a distance of several kilometres. A car followed me through the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street the car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.

column1: I studied for almost one week for my physics examination. With difficulty
column2: I passed the exam. I was angry with the teacher and also with myself because I had not remembered enough during the exam and because the time that I spent studying was wasted.

column1: I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I cried for several days because I was so sad.
A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very disgusting
column2: especially because I was eating.

column1: At a carnival party
column2: I smooched with a man - some days later I was rather ashamed of that.

column1: For fun
column2: I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room
column3: crying.

column1: During my first week in Graz
column2: I met a girl who I had got to know on the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered her very sympathetic
column3: we had separated without changing our addresses.

column1: Many years ago I saw the film Psycho by Hitchcock for the first time. When I saw the film I was alone and afterwards
column2: I hardly dared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep.

column1: I had got a bad cold. My father said I must be crazy to go by motorbike at those temperatures. When I answered him that I did not care about a cold
column2: he said that if I did not care for anything I could leave him (it was for the second time he said something like that).

column1: I was at home alone when I realized that a young roe approached our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It a limped. Sometime later
column2: when I thought that it had already run away
column3: I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.

column1: Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains once a week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was terrible - nevertheless
column2: we all ate rather much and had an improper and unsavoury conversation.

column1: My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory comments about him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had died recently.
When I still went to primary school
column2: I went on a ski trip with my family. After skiing
column3: we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second a key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.

column1: I had not studied very much for my final examination at school
column2: so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I heard that I had passed it.

column1: When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is not a complicated operation
column2: but just before it started I was very afraid so I will never forget it.

column1: My parents are divorced
column2: father pays alimony for me. Two years ago my sister who lives with her father
column3: suddenly asked her mother for money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered her too small
column4: she brought an action against her mother. I was terribly angry with my sister.

column1: I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come a home late in the morning. The next day I called him - he was not at a home. As something like that had happened to me several times before
column2: I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody and I felt very sad.

column1: Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.
When I slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for three reasons. First
column2: because I was only 13 years old
column3: second
column4: a because I did not really like him
column5: third
column6: because he had caught me napping.

column1: I had been together with my boyfriend for two and a half years when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a bit guilty for what had happened.
My boyfriend told me that he would take me to the training of the life-saving dog.
I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red switch.
A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beat him until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.
A horse which I liked very much was taken away.
On TV I saw a report about the church in Amerika. A priest was shown who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt disgusted.
When I was a child
column2: my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after me and insisted on my apology.

column1: I quarrelled with my boyfriend. He said it was unfair that I always started crying so he had to give in.
To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination
column2: I did not spend the night with my girlfriend but in the students' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when I had the exam
column3: somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock in the morning. My girlfriend who likes sleeping late had come to be able to be with me.

column1: I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time I developed a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of my examination of anatomy. While other students were examined
column2: I was dissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting with fear until it was my turn.

column1: When I come home in the evening
column2: the first thing I do is sit down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally desolate state. My girlfriend had wanted to tidy up but had not finished.

column1: My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so my own feelings were intensified.
When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed only helplessness and indecision.
I spent an evening with my girlfriend. When we wanted to go to bed I was totally drunk. The next morning I felt rather ashamed.
I threw away an object
column2: which belonged to a friend because I did not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that and I felt guilty.

column1: After a long time
column2: I saw my boyfriend again.

column1: My first public appearance was in front of a rather big audience.
I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg
column2: especially when I saw a discussion about it on TV.

column1: Death of my father died of laryngeal cancer.
When I got indecent offers.
When I bought new skis
column2: I was ashamed to tell the assistant that I am not good at skiing and therefore bought racing skis.

column1: My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend himself very well
column2: I should have taken his part.

column1: I thought that I had failed an examination
column2: but when I was informed about the mark
column3: I saw that I had passed it.

column1: Before an examination: I had the feeling that I had not learned enough.
Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I would win
column2: but at last
column3: I lost the game.

column1: My grandfather's funeral.
In the cinema
column2: I saw a film which showed how a person has torn out his guts when he was still alive.

column1: I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me something which they thought I should know. Actually
column2: I know it
column3: but at that time I was not able to remember it.

column1: I had an appointment with a friend. I promised to meet with him
column2: but at last
column3: I did not without having informed him.

column1: When I had a psychical crisis
column2: I met a girl
column3: who told me that she had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome them.

column1: I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on my fingers. Out of fear
column2: I was almost unable to climb down.

column1: A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because of an occurrence that had happened some time ago). When I heard about that I was very angry.
My grandfather was seriously ill
column2: he had only a few days left to live. I had always loved him but never told him. When I saw him for the last time
column3: I had the feeling that I had omitted so many things I could not do again. - There was a fly sitting on his forehead and he was too weak to drive it away. I was very sad when I saw that.

column1: Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes
column2: and we do not speak about sexual things
column3: too. But once he told such a vulgar joke
column4: a that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me
column5: but some of his friends
column6: and I were present.

column1: When I was 6 or 7 years old
column2: I pulled down the trousers of a friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We never spoke about that
column3: I think it was as embarrassing for her as it was for me.

column1: When I told my boyfriend
column2: who loved me very much
column3: that I wanted to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him that and also a long time after that I felt guilty because I had hurt him so much.

column1: Unexpectedly I met some people who I like very much. a Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me into their group
column2: although it was late in the evening.

column1: After a football match I went home by car
column2: a friend drove. I did not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I told him to be cautious
column3: but he did not care.

column1: A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I am always angry about that because it is an unnecessary luxury. Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again. When I had already put the oil into the pan
column2: he poured it out again and put the butter into the pan.

column1: fter some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for several days and we had got on very well. When they left
column2: I had a feeling of emptiness.

column1: I had a quarrel with a friend who lived with me in the same flat. a He moved out. Before he went he invited me and some friends for a drink. At last
column2: he was totally drunk and smelled disgusting. Besides
column3: he told lies about us and behaved as if he was to be pitied.

column1: I went to see a friend. There were other people
column2: too
column3: and everybody brought some presents. I was the only one who brought nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything - although I knew how he felt.

column1: With a group of handicapped people
column2: we went to a party. When we wanted to leave we were not able to find one of these people. I had told his mother that we would leave at 4.30 p.m.
column3: actually
column4: it was planned for 3.30 p.m. Therefore there was a delay.

column1: I had a quarrel with my fiance. When he admitted his fault
column2: everything was alright. It was then for the first time that he surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.

column1: After my boyfriend had beaten me for the first time
column2: I always trembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard steps coming nearer.

column1: I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine for my fiance. But he stayed in another town and spent one a thousand shillings in a restaurant during the same time.
I had to give up my love because it did not work out well.
I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.
My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show a the letter the door
column2: which was almost crashed
column3: I felt ashamed.

column1: I spied on my fiance and was jealous. Later I saw that there was no reason for that.
My sister had a daughter. I saw the baby for the first time through a pane of glass and she looked at me.
My mother
column2: my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to turn it off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid that he would do us harm.

column1: I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching a fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had paid for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would require.
When I was 9 years old
column2: I got a cat
column3: but after 3 days he died. I was unfortunate because I had nursed him and taken him to the veterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for a short time I liked him very much.

column1: When my grandmother was about 80 years old
column2: she lived with us for several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breathe the air that smelled of her presence.

column1: I am left-handed. When I attended the first form
column2: we learned to write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was looking at my notebook. I was ashamed.

column1: When I was 4
column2: we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and her friend wanted to go to a bay in an undangerous way. I wanted to arrive before them and went on a shorter
column3: but more dangerous way. When I arrived
column4: I found nobody there. I waited for a long time
column5: but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had been searching for me desperately. She did not scold me
column6: but I saw how much she had worried (herself).

column1: When I was 17
column2: I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling light
column3: which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became unimportant
column4: I heard or saw the words overcome egotism. The feeling of joy remained for months after that experience.

column1: When we had swimming instruction
column2: we had to take a header from a springboard. I usually refused to do that
column3: but at least I was forced to.

column1: When I played in a chess championship
column2: I was disturbed by other people. I asked them to be quiet but in vain.

column1: When a new one replaced my flute teacher.
When I was a child
column2: I was sometimes forced to eat things that disgusted me.

column1: When I was 12 years old
column2: some friends from our family had come to watch TV. I lay on the floor and moved my pelvis. When the other people had gone
column3: my mother told me that it had looked as if I had wanted to make sex.

column1: When I shirked the gymnastics lesson I met the director of our school who asked me what I was doing.
When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me
column2: I moved back to my parents. For my father
column3: it went without saying anything (normally he often grumbles at me).

column1: I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me
column2: that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually
column3: her husband could not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.

column1: I have a huge family. At my grandmother's funeral
column2: we all met and everybody pretended to mourn. In reality
column3: it was like a fashion show: everybody wanted to show himself.

column1: Often a dog treated very badly by his owner comes to us.
After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat
column2: one of them did not want to leave
column3: because he wanted to sleep with me. He said that he had fallen in love with me
column4: that he felt alone and so on.

column1: I look up to my Karate-teacher. When I came to a training lesson after I had not trained for one week
column2: I was totally stiff. I was ashamed.

column1: My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km an off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel guilty.
When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school (with success).
Before my final examination.
When my mother kept me in leading strings.
When my father died.
When I worked at the life-saving service and saw the first exit.
When I made a fool at an examination.
When I had wrongly explained to someone an important example for an examination.
Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with whom I get along very well.
Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several reasons: because it was for the first time
column2: because the medical check-up might be painful
column3: because of the uncertainty and because someone had informed me about it.

column1: My girlfriend did not understand me
column2: I was angry with myself because I had problems when we separated - I could not resign myself to it.

column1: A friend who was 22 years old died.
When I was in the army
column2: we got a certain dish for dinner that I a do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat
column3: but I was very hungry.

column1: I had to pay a fine because of speeding.
A friend who was 22 years old
column2: died of leukaemia
column3: I had not known that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.

column1: When we got a young dog.
I was afraid before I went to the doctor.
I had an accident with damage to the car's body.
My dog died of a cerebral tumour.
When I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by a patient whose outward appearance was distasteful.
When I was a child
column2: I had a medical check-up. I had to undress and was examined by several doctors.

column1: When a classmate wanted to sit down
column2: I pulled his chair away
column3: so that he was slightly injured.

column1: When I heard that a good friend
column2: who had been abroad for a long time
column3: would come and see me.

column1: When I had my first oral examination after a long time
column2: especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling that I had not studied enough and had not had enough time to make up for it.

column1: I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room
column2: although they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.

column1: When my brother died.
I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting open their stomachs and taking out their bowels.
When I was a child: I told my mother a lie and she found it out.

My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad about that.
I unexpectedly got a present from my father.
When I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the night.
My boyfriend had promised to come home at about 10 p.m. He did not return until midnight and consumed a lot of alcohol.
A relative
column2: whom I like very much
column3: left for the United States.

column1: When I was walking on the street
column2: I slipped on the dung of a dog. I did not fall down
column3: but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my sole.

column1: Some people
column2: who are important to me
column3: came to see me and I had not washed the dishes.

column1: I was looking after my cousin's little daughter
column2: and she fell down
column3: was slightly injured and cried vociferously.

column1: I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long time.
I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.
A friend had promised to get me a book which was very important for my work
column2: but she forgot about it.

column1: My dog
column2: whom I had had for eleven years
column3: died. I watched his purification.

column1: A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately
column2: I was able to break loose.

column1: When I stayed on a nudism beach
column2: a man was watching me in a disagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining my body.

column1: I had a quarrel with my father. He was depressed because somebody had treated him unjustly. As we had an argument
column2: it was impossible for me to help him.

column1: My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at the station.
After a motor accident (I was the front-seat passenger) I spit blood.
At an office
column2: an application that I had made was turned down a because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.

column1: My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.
I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her awfully.
After an oral examination
column2: I shook the professor's hand
column3: but he had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.

column1: I spread abroad an intimate secret.
I bought a Christmas present for my girlfriend. On my way home I was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.
My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my girlfriend had fallen in love with another man
column2: I was afraid to lose her.

column1: I was angry when I watched a ski race. All the Austrian skiers dropped out.
During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit suicide. She had just left the hospital
column2: her lips were trembling
column3: and she looked miserable.

column1: On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a woman who were quarrelling
column2: beating each other
column3: shouting and so on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other in such a degrading way.

column1: My girlfriend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get along very well and usually
column2: we share everything. Once we two were sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.

column1: I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying in another room
column2: but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying - and it started crying again.

column1: I went to fetch my girlfriend at the station. When the train arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me
column2: I felt glad.

column1: When I wanted to go into a house
column2: there was suddenly a big dog standing beside me. It was hardly moving
column3: but I did not know how it would react later on.

column1: My father had bought too many goods for his shop
column2: there was not enough space to store them.

column1: A friend died of cancer when he was 18 years old.
At a party
column2: I saw two people fighting. The aggression and the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression on me.

column1: During a discussion
column2: I said something rather stupid and unnecessary.

column1: When I was driving my car
column2: I wanted to pick something from the floor of the car and drove into the guide rail. I thought that I should not have done that and felt guilty.

column1: On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.
I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamt that a stranger was in my house.
My boyfriend had promised me to come at 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours late.
When I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.
When I broke the piggy bank of my brother and my mother a discovered that.
I was sitting in a restaurant with friends and I knew that in the meantime my girlfriend must have come to my flat and found the door closed.
After I had been away for a long time a friend told me that I had a passed all my written examinations.
Recently my younger brother disappeared for two days without leaving a trace. Usually
column2: he tells me when he wants to do something like that
column3: therefore I was afraid that something had happened to him.

column1: I played chess with my 12-year-old brother. I made a stupid mistake - and he won!
It was only once that I felt sad: at my grandfather's funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).
3 years ago I served in the army. Once a colleague denounced me a because of a delict
column2: which is usually committed. I was arrested for 3 days. I still detest this man.

column1: Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from sleep.
When I was in puberty I smashed my favourite toy my little brother because in a fit of rage.
After I had had a disappointment in my private life
column2: my friend
column3: who studies in Vienna
column4: came to see me spontaneously.

column1: Before an oral examination - which I did not take eventually.
A friend had promised to give me a lift to Graz. To be sure I called her before we went. She told me that she had just promised another person to give him a lift.
I am sad because some relationships with friends are not very good.
I think I have hardly had a situation where I felt disgusted. Perhaps once
column2: when I saw a big spider.

column1: When my boyfriend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.
I promised my mother to come home on her birthday
column2: but at last
column3: I was prevented. Nevertheless
column4: it would have been possible to go but I did not.

column1: Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.
An unknown person knocked repeatedly on the backdoor when no one else was at home.
Boyfriend chatting up another girl.
A friend broke up with her boyfriend.
Accidentally seeing a friend in a compromising situation with a stranger.
Parents found out I smoked.
Not thanking relatives for a favour done.
Emotional reassurances by a spouse.
Movement in the bush late at night while camping.
A heated discussion with the spouse concerning the new house.
Loss of close relative.
The price I was charged for work on my car.
Caused fault in V.C.R. by not following instructions carefully.
Losing my temper with my spouse.
A night spent with a group of friends.
A car came very close to hitting me whilst I was crossing the street.
A friend whom I had gone out of my way to do something for did not bother to acknowledge my efforts and treated me badly thereafter.
A girlfriend ended our relationship abruptly and unexpectedly.
A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 years old) to my not responding in his favour to a request
column2: that is: he asked me for some money I refused
column3: and his reaction was quite childish.

column1: On one occasion whilst engaging in horseplay with my girlfriend
column2: I caused her to be physically harmed.

column1: I borrowed money from a friend and did not pay back the debt when I said I would.
Getting a phone call from a very old friend.
Before giving a seminar to a rather large audience.

column3: in its resultant flight

column7: and also for me to get it out of the shaft. To prevent its suffering a slow death

column1: I had promised to contact a friend about a particular matter by a certain date
