column1: It was quite recently
column2: at the football match between the national teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish referee who ran the match quite partially.

column1: When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and a which I had listened to before together with friends.
A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.
I counterfeited a mark in the school register during a lesson in gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later when I stood a face to face with my teacher
column2: whom I highly appreciated and respected.

column1: In a fit of temper
column2: I told things that were unjust and they greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.

column1: I passed successfully the preliminary exam for participation in the children's Assembly.
I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock someone knocked violently on the door.
A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he didn't come.
I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I got separated a year ago and when comparing him with my present one with whom things are not much of a success.
Recently in the tram
column2: a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend a then over me.

column1: I had to prepare a report but I couldn't write it. I read from a book off-hand
column2: I was quite uneasy and I felt I didn't manage.

column1: My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call from a mine.
Bulgaria won a football match against France.
I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.
I was neglected undeservedly.
My grandmother died.
A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.
I didn't offer my seat to a pregnant woman on the bus.
I didn't attend lectures.
I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.
The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt fear in the hospital yard
column2: I feared if everything was going to be in order.

column1: About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the due maternity benefit
column2: because of bureaucratic reasons.

column1: Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.
I feel disgusted with some people when I see what they are capable of
column2: including lack of any dignity
column3: when trying to find a seat in a tram.

column1: Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight but my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spirit of a good driver.
Some days ago I had a slight car accident my fault.
The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. I can say those were the happiest months of my life.
Fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his behaviour.
When I encountered not only my father's lack of understanding but also his unwillingness to understand me as a parent
column2: as far as things for which I (not he) have proven to be a right are concerned.

column1: The fact that my husband and I are not on good terms.
I was disgusted by a quarrel between two married people
column2: in which the children were involved as accusers of one of the parents.

column1: When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.
When I am not able to fulfil any request of my son - can't take him out to ride his bike
column2: because I am tired.

column1: I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty days.
I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was not quite justifiable
column2: I still remember it.

column1: I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. a Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come a home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.
A fear of lack of personal powers.
At an undeserved attitude toward a man
column2: when a human personality is not treated decently.

column1: At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).
At an unworthy behaviour of a man
column2: pettiness
column3: stupidity and mostly at philistinism.

column1: At a weakness on my part.
When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.
When I was admitted to the University.
Because of a conflict with my parents
column2: there was a possibility of interrupting my studies.

column1: I feel strong anger when I am treated unjustly.
During a prolonged separation from my family.
I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of a rat.
I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am not prepared to overcome a certain obstacle in my life.
I offended a person who had done much for me and who had helped me with everything.
The day when my son said for the first time mummy.
Before an exam in logic.
My husband and I were invited to the house of our neighbours then we got an invitation to the part of my parents which we had to refuse. As a result
column2: they called me by words that provoked my anger.

column1: My son lives in the country. I feel sad when I see mothers having walked with their children.
The behaviour of a colleague of mine doesn't correspond to my norms of behaviour.
I was to take part in a cocktail party on the occasion of our national holiday as a servant.
I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.
The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression
column2: as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the situative feeling but in this case
column3: the reason is not in me
column4: it's out of me.

column1: I bet that I would jump out of a window. I was sure that I would jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.
An honest slide on the part of a girlfriend of mine. Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books.
Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial explanation.
A lie on the part of a person close to me.
I thought I had taken a decision but I hesitated.
I feel this feeling most often before me
column2: not before others. a My outside is iron but actually
column3: I'm wasting away.

column1: My son was born.
I had a car accident.
I was drawn up with a statement for an infringement of the traffic ordinance. In fact
column2: I was innocent.

column1: I lost a close friend.
I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war. After the film
column2: I felt disgusted.

column1: I was nailed. I lied in connection with a book which I took from a library because I had to keep it for a longer time.
I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. My friend relied on them.
After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I passed my last exam.
Before going to the dentist.
When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological investigation and then I got really angry.
When I feel I must be with somebody
column2: to talk with somebody - but I am alone.

column1: Some time ago a man tried to teach me something. Tried because it is very difficult to teach somebody when you yourself are not competent and cultured.
I am ashamed when I am not ready for my seminar on internal diseases
column2: simply because the assistant professor is a person who deserves high respect.

column1: We had promised
column2: with a friend of mine
column3: to take our friends to a restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without finding one
column4: and not being helped by the others we had to give up an idea.

column1: When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often happens.
When I have to go in for an exam and an examiner is a person with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.
I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant
column2: a since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.

column1: It happened that I was alone - with no contact with friends.
I met three drunk boys
column2: almost children
column3: they didn't look like normal people.

column1: I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistant professor whom I highly respect.
I got back too late after a Sunday going out without having a call-up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept the whole night.
I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love with me.
I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.
I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent words.
When my dog was stolen.

I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder people to force me to a norm of behaviour without having legal or moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very loudly and threatened that with connections she will expel me from the inst.
I experienced this long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in a foreign language.
My mother developed hypertonia and I think I too am to blame because with her it is a stress disease.
When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.
One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story
column2: nobody took it seriously but I got frightened.

column1: I got angry with a stranger on a train who behaved impertinently and immorally
When I failed the first entrance exam.
The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.
Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.
I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.
Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly feelings. With him
column2: I found much in common - in our views and our fate.

column1: A few days ago I experienced fear. It was connected with unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked in me many negative emotions.
I always get angry when somebody deceives me or tries to conceal his lie skilfully and this offends me even more.
Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my general impression from several situations which evoked this feeling in me.
I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted
column2: who I had trusted
column3: the man who should have been my mainstay - my father. a I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can happen in this world.

column1: I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother and sister
column2: and with me too.

column1: I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man
column2: and in this way
column3: I lost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot of trouble.

column1: When I was accepted as a student.
I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something wrong with my liver. However
column2: it turned out that it was not serious and I need not worry.

column1: With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come with me to an occasion (she was from another town).
For the girl who helped me go on living and made me happy - when I don't see her even for two or three days.
For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening
column2: and who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.

column1: I was embarrassed by the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed of myself - how little I knew and how good the examiner was. I rarely become ashamed.
Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my mother's presence.
I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was not afraid to face death and that I also helped a little to relieve the pains of a patient.
Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw another one
column2: as if out of control of the driver.

column1: I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she kept on telling lies.
Sadness
column2: no
column3: I felt something much stronger when my father died.

column1: I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street. I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudeness.
I was ashamed of the way I was deceived and that I could not help a friend
column2: although it was possible for me. Nothing was revealed but I haven't called up this person since then.

column1: I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them
column2: so the girl missed a day for the preparation for her term exams.

column1: When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.
Two years ago I saw a film on TV. Even now it makes me afraid.
When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
The loss of a person I loved very much.
Deception from a person I loved very much.
I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them that I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying but she didn't stop me.
The assistant professor saw me cheat on the preliminary examination.
I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted as a student in medicine.
I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on the terrace of the flat.
I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for the term examinations.
I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither his fault nor mine.
I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words at a man without any reason whatsoever.
At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a colleague (she asked me something) and the assistant professor made me a sharp remark.
My grandmother has been in hospital for a week and I still haven't had time to see her.
When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me alone for a few years.
I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of hours.
Some time ago I was disgusted with the cleanness of the refectory of our institute.

We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium (the stadium was packed with people) I lost my shoe in the crowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any results and I had to go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the whole town!

I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was on the verge of not passing the supplementary examinations.

When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many people about my applying for this institute and I decided to prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any preparatory course. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.
Once as a child
column2: I dreamed of fire. Since that time I hadn't wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness (and so it is now).

column1: A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the guilty one kept silent. I stepped in front and told the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll call and threatened me.

Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every school-girl I was daydreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left each other. No one was to blame but I felt a deep sadness. Even now I remember it quite often.
It was at a common (??) meeting
column2: the last one because we were to graduate. The way one of my fellow students behaved made me feel disgusted.

column1: I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders
column2: and my coevals) were very kind to us. One night we smeared our foreign friends with toothpaste while they were sleeping and then we roused the whole camp with our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I didn't utter a word for two days
column3: then I went to apologize.

column1: When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our mark books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my classmates about the scolding they had gotten at home. My first mark was in geography - a good 4. I judged I had known for more than that and I put down very good for fear of being scolded. Naturally
column2: my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for what I had done.

column1: When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general one).
I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it rolled by and hit me.

My grandmother's brother had taken an active part in the resistance movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his health. He became an invalid. When we phoned First Aid the nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old he was (79).
My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we had to get separated again.
I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for the eighth of March and asked for a foreign perfume instead.
I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well prepared for the subjects but he put some side issues me and I couldn't answer.
I had undertaken to help my sister with her class work but some unexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.
I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard about it over the phone
column2: I didn't believe it at first.

column1: I had worries about a certain illness.

I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that it was done by a good acquaintance of mine.
When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him understand I felt miserable.
I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my affairs with my future husband. After that
column2: she behaved as if nothing had happened.

column1: I feel shame when I have made a promise
column2: but I can't keep it and this has negative effects which are caused by my behaviour.

column1: I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I said I had not passed my last exam.
I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry examination.
This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance a Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.
I was confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently
column2: the pedology lecturer was the cause.

column1: This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car accident.
I am disgusted with the behaviour of a car driver whose car would run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.
I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.
A sense of guilt came over me too
column2: when I interrupted my studies. Why? Because I felt guilty before my parents! They believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.

column1: I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant
column2: at my working a place
column3: I got a message that I was admitted as a full-time student at a Higher Agricultural Institute.

column1: Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first-night fatigue my duty as a soldier.
When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.
I am disgusted with a neighbour who is looking for all sorts of a quarrel between my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.
Some time ago I promised to meet an acquaintance of mine and to carry him some promised papers. I haven't done it until this day. a Now I feel quite awkward when I meet him.
A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discontinue my studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.
After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had a got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he feels glad.
Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance examinations.
I feel angry at people's indifference to our ability to be present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.
When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for my early years
column2: for the freedom and the carefree years of childhood.

column1: I feel disgusted with the bootlickers
column2: with helpless people.

column1: I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.
I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days later he died.
I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry
column2: I was very excited because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.

column1: Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations most of all. I remember I was horror-stricken before my microbiology exam because it was a decisive one.

It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned out that there was no audience at all because everyone had pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got furious.
When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I can't remember a concrete example now. For example
column2: I have just parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

column1: In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords
column2: quite intelligent people
column3: warned me I had to move in the nearest future. But I had difficulties moving my luggage because I couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them threatening me that they would throw out my things. And at that my luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was quite disappointed and disgusted.

column1: During our last exercise in agricultural machines
column2: we went out in the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have fulfilled our task well
column3: because when our teacher came and asked me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he didn't deserve it.

column1: I remember an unpleasant event about my mother. I felt guilty before her.
When I succeeded in establishing contact with a girl (who is now my girlfriend).
I fear before each exam.
When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.
When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.
When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teacher tried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. I a burned with shame then.
When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home because she was busy and this work was to be done by a man. But it remained undone.
I feel joy usually after each taken exam
column2: the last one was in February.

column1: It was not long ago when two of my friends of mine got quite drunk and one of them began to rave under the influence of alcohol. I felt fear of what could have happened.
I felt anger at my last exam
column2: I felt angry with our teacher
column3: a because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.

column1: I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness
column2: I think I can call it so.

column1: I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.
Immediately after the New Year holidays
column2: I happened to visit a party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the next day
column3: I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said and done the night before.

column1: Last year I put off an exam for the autumn session without knowing if there was a supplementary examination session. When I came home with my exam unpassed I felt guilty before my parents when I remembered how much they had done for me.
When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.
I felt fear when I fell and broke my leg into pieces and I could not feel it at all.
I felt angry when I failed an exam about which I knew quite a few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.
When my mother and father were on an excursion in Czechoslovakia and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the events that were taking place there.
I felt disgusted with alcohol in general when a close friend of mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it was quite shameful.
I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceived them.
I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident but as my parents did not know who was to blame
column2: they punished my brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it impossible that had driven the car.

column1: I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural Institute.
I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last a year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.
That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal marks.
I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something had irrevocably gone away from me.
I felt disgusted with a lady teacher who used to nag
column2: mock
column3: and interrupt every one of my fellow students each time we had a class with her in our first year.

column1: That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then was caught.
I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam I had had enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.
I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.
It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and told us my father was badly injured in an accident.
I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the institute in the first class
column2: despite the high mark I had gotten on the entrance examination.

column1: Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives in my home town.
I feel disgusted with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love in an abominable way.
I have always felt ashamed of some people's behaviour towards their too-old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have left them to the mercy of fate.
I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have to tell them I have failed an exam.
Naturally
column2: when I got discharged this was my second birthday.

column1: When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.
A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced this feeling when I tried to chase her out.
After my father's death.
With an alcoholic.
Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not have enough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people there and I felt quite awkward.
Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I was directly involved in it.
I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for a long period
column2: my father came back home.

column1: I was terrified during an excursion in Italy. I was lost and left alone in this unfamiliar country.
I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and anger.
When my first girlfriend and I left each other.
During a summer holiday at a bar
column2: I happened to see a dead-to-the-world woman.

column1: When I first had sexual intercourse.
I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set quite involuntarily.
When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at a kindergarten.
When I first sat for an entrance examination.
When a teacher pretending to be a highly cultivated teacher and a man
column2: slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite undeservedly.

column1: When I got separated from my first love.
Many times
column2: when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated physically me and my mother.

column1: When for the first and the last time I tried to crib and the teacher was with her back to me but right when I was taking the materials out she turned round and saw me.
When at times conscientiously I speak to my mother in a high tome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.
Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
Watching a horror movie with friends.
The breakup of a relationship. After the event
column2: I was upset/sad a then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

column1: The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was my age
column2: there were many of my friends present
column3: as well as her family etc.

column1: Disgusting with a person who treated me badly
column2: and has treated other people similarly - including lying
column3: hiding facts
column4: being deceitful
column5: unfair
column6: etc.

column1: Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in effect lowering myself to their level.
Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in the hospital after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.
Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She wasn't confident about handling the situation so was thinking of leaving the job only after 2 days of employment.
Walking home at night after university - part of the way
column2: there are no lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the thought of no one hearing me if I have to scream.

column1: When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he knows needs doing.
When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother who had passed away about a month ago.
With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and urinated on the floor in front of everyone.
When I found a letter addressed To Mum by my son
column2: 6 months later
column3: he begged me not to sell his new shoes which he messed up after wearing them for the first time.

column1: When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we had discussed and I had to be one better.
Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings despite my own being hurt in the process.
In a sociology class
column2: I felt very angry towards some members of a society for exploiting the Polynesian people
column3: and dawn raids by the Police (Martin Luther King
column4: Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a reflection of my shortcomings.

column1: Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square
column2: Aotea square. a Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I went into the role of a performing clown.

column1: I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself
column2: and my homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention. Especially in learning another language.

column1: I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my a parent father
column2: the shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived a self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as an I am.

column1: I felt guilty about being part of the successful people. Felt guilty about being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this an emotion)
When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd taught her at 6 yrs
column2: then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last a 3-4 yrs
column3: she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for a Council.

column1: A Maori language oral test
column2: yesterday - Although I had studied intensely - once in the examiner's room I blew it - I was so nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important
column3: but I got only blankness.

column1: A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden was not as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her for a year - She implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time
column2: and taking 3 University exams part-time).

column1: When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust saddened me.

People who came to our home - and requested Put out your smoke. That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to the situation.
Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual family a friends dinner. Told Not to Speak. Their attitude toward him was negative/I was in my mid-20s
column2: and I had done many things - a wide range of experiences. Probably greater than he.

column1: Not attending school
column2: when am not sick - but in need of mental rest. Staff on your return query your sickness - it is easier in N.Z. to be sick
column3: rather than confide other personal reasons etc.

column1: My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.
A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a small Lazer).
A shop Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December a last year.
My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - Lord Grey died in his sleep - His death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.
A sour-looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.
I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did not accept my Visa!
When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.
When my daughter was born.
When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I felt intense fear at the time she was wheeled away.

When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving. a We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the time.
When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.
When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with a rugby tour of South Africa.
When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenous language of Maori at an important function where I was the only woman in the group and it was expected of me.
When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important family occasion that I should not have missed.
Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 years
column2: at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the paperwork collecting bags and the anticipation of coming through the customs gate.

column1: I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into the boat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water. Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming and someone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim
column2: I abruptly ended up swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few days until we had left the district.

column1: My partner without discussing it with me the situation decided it was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his own life for the next 6-12 months
column2: then told me the day before it was about to happen had been tolerant and friendly for the preceding week.

column1: I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole new set of friends
column2: leaving them at the airport was sad and traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I a wouldn't see many of them again.

column1: After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and continue my studies.

This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I always end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting so much over unimportant trivial matters.
When my grandmother
column2: who has been living with us for 14 years
column3: had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes me feel sad.

column1: A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people had had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading
column2: immoral manner - especially females exposing and flaunting themselves with no shame or embarrassment.

column1: Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began to feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it was only the thing to do
column2: and not an act of love.

column1: This feeling of guilt applies to moral/religious views. I (being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe in and had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many months later
column2: when I was doing some deeper self-analysis I began to feel guilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted for myself and my future.

column1: My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along too.
My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway
column2: if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are perhaps dead.

column1: Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise a roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn at doing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can't be bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.
To be closer to the university I have left home and moved to Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially my family - forever.
A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but is quite happy for him to play around with - as well as herself.
I did not attend a social studies observation class for 1 whole week (I am a student trainee teacher). Anyway
column2: the other teachers thought this was okay because the teacher I was supposed to observe was not well-liked. The teacher was nice to me - but I wanted to get out of teaching a hard topic he had given me.

column1: Passing my pharmacy exams meant my tertiary education in pharmacy was completed.
When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to back up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was only about 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.
When my boyfriend wouldn't dance with me on my graduation night because he thought I could dance with my friendly friends.
When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2 a yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and he diagnosed it.
My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me verbally.
I found I was pregnant and unmarried.
When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to Catholicism but then once received - o.k.

Joy for me is when all my family gather around the home for special occasions such as Christmas etc. It gives me the joy to see my family and relatives and to observe nature's productivity process which has been going on for centuries.
I had this experience of fear when a few people were fighting at a social one night
column2: in which one of my relatives was involved. My fear was great for him because he was being assaulted badly.

column1: Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.
This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish our relationship due to some circumstances between her and her family. I was really sad
column2: and hurt and couldn't find any reason why am I still living. What is this life all about? This was one of the few questions which crept up vividly every time I thought about what had happened.

column1: I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their bodies with drugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usually as an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they do things stupidly and unjustly.
This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.
Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e.
column2: ill feelings.

column1: Had fear of losing their husband.
When my present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self - a to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a future daughter-in-law.
When the boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.
Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering
column2: over-protecting and selfish attitudes.

column1: When ditched - divorced my husband.
When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of a group.

My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made me really happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she asked me.
That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and didn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adopted at 14.
(1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year after my father died and this angered me more as I thought he should be dead and not my father.
My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two days after.

A child told me she had been sexually abused by her stepfather. a I only knew the child and had not come into contact with either parent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event and a stepfather disgusted me.
When my natural parent's name would show up on papers and not my
column2: what I call real name.

column1: I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to find out and I had to tell her I had lied.
Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.
When a man
column2: a stranger to me
column3: personally insulted a close woman a friend of mine in public.

column1: After my father died suddenly of a heart attack.
When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of mine.
When I went to explain to a lecturer whom I liked that the work expected of me was not going to be in.
When I masturbated in my room.
When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And our relationship was new
column2: fresh
column3: vital etc. once again.

column1: My daughter was 2 yrs she went up to a colt and tried to hit it. It turned on her and kicked her over the heart
column2: sending her flying through the air. I left my mother and sister to deal with her as they are nurses. I felt I didn't want to know if she was going to die
column3: it was just too much.

column1: My anger is with men
column2: and their inability to be human (not all men).

column1: The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed
column2: a hitch-hiking to work.

column1: With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanted to send the All Blacks to South Africa.
That my brother and father are into alcohol
column2: two men with a privilege. Not using it positively.

column1: When I betrayed my lover
column2: she told me something in confidence
column3: I felt at the time I had to relay the information back to the person concerned
column4: as I felt the situation volatile
column5: did this without telling my lover
column6: and she felt like piggy in the middle
column7: as a she was not directly concerned. Maybe you could call it to gossip I a felt different after I had slept on it. If I had waited
column9: a NOW I would not have done it.

column1: A good friend
column2: the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the time for an informal greeting in the church service. She said a few words.

column1: I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I expected it to be very active with people
column2: gangs
column3: fast cars etc
column4: a thought it was actually quite quiet
column5: though also oppressive. I walked about half a mile and bought a drink along the way.

column1: Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I had made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after I had just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.
Sitting on a bus
column2: I heard behind
column3: the voice of a girl I was friendly with. After her talking for some time with another girl I decided it wasn't her in fact that someone miming her
column4: which it was when I finally looked. I was talking to a friend at the time.

column1: Having moved into a flat within the last week I felt some disgust that a bathroom tap had been left to drip with a faulty faucet.
I criticised an action of my mother and for the first time
column2: she genuinely took notice of it. I felt shame that I was almost taking the part of a husband
column3: or at least an equal which I should not have.

column1: I felt that I contributed to a possible rift in the relationship between a boy and girl soon to be married
column2: in my flat after I moved in. After stating my celibacy to him which she overheard and didn't previously know about I suspect.

column1: My friend replied to my letter again saying he was attracted to me and suggesting we write
column2: talk and get together and see how things went his suggestion that I could ring and do that was really good - though really insane conversation.

column1: Being sexually assaulted (not rape
column2: but passionate kissing) by a friend's father - he stopped when he was driving me home. I hadn't wanted the lift
column3: had refused 3 times
column4: and then felt it'd be rude to refuse again. Was really afraid of what he might do.

column1: I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end of my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry and told him to get out. He was surprised and hesitated
column2: I started to move towards him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly
column3: but firmly to go. Because I'd got the initiative
column4: I succeeded. A very powerful message.

column1: When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died because she was old
column2: but because she lived for the last few years in an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers - a no chair
column3: or private space
column4: and when I went to visit she would be a sitting in the living room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't.

column1: When during a social evening with my father
column2: brother
column3: sister
column4: a close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with my father
column5: who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.

column1: When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal feelings and then days later changed her mind.
When a close friend wilfully cheated me.
While intoxicated I invaded someone's (a girl's) personal space to a large extent.
While intoxicated I damaged my sister's car in a minor way and someone else in a minor way.
Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from an airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in contact again.
Fear of punishment for having broken an item of value to my parents.
That a friend had been badly beaten and stabbed many times and a person that did it got away without any punishment from the law.
The death of an animal we had reared.
Finding that a girlfriend of mine was a prostitute and had been seeing many others during our relationship.
Not having owned up to the responsibility of an incident where a family car received minor damage.
Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up
column2: partly the use of another person.

column1: The feeling of joy when again I had confessed my sin and experienced God's forgiving grace and cleansing power - total enlightenment and freedom - bliss.
Riding through a bush fire on an island in Australia - on a pushbike as a little boy - all alone
column2: lost and surrounded by a smouldering wood and flame.

column1: When bicycling along
column2: a courier van started to tail me very close a - I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reacted violently
column3: physically responding to the dangerous situation.

column1: My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down - no one else was there to do it.
When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with came up to me after I had used her and acted as if nothing had changed.
When a close friend entrusted me with a secret and I let the cat an out of the bag.
Making a sexual pass at my cousin with whom I have a very close personal relationship.
First time I slept with my present girlfriend. Had been best friends for a year but had been hesitant about getting involved emotionally.
Waiting for a taxi - when within 1/2 an hour two separate people challenged me to fight for no apparent reason except they were drunk.
Deliberately provoked by someone close. Angered by the deliberation
column2: not the provocation.

column1: My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. These instances summed up all the negative aspects of our relationship which at the time seemed doomed to fail.
A close friend took part in a racist violent action.
Cannot recall the emotion with any force.
Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and me.
Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position whereby my financial
column2: physical
column3: spiritual and emotional needs will be well catered for. This position fulfils a lot of my aims for the last five years of my life.

column1: When I decided to leave my steady
column2: secure employment to come to a university. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all the requirements of the study and also being older I didn't know if I would enjoy mixing with younger people
column3: also financial insecurity.

column1: When a close friend failed to live up to the expectations I had of him - thereby causing pain to his spouse. I believe that my anger was probably a reaction to fear that I wouldn't be able to live up to my expectations.
The departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas
column2: a sharing in the sorrow of her parents who were left behind.

column1: I get disgusted with the inherent racist attitudes of my brother-in-law in putting down various ethnic groups and also my unwillingness to challenge him about these attitudes to keep the peace.

My failure to provide the appropriate emotional/spiritual level to a sexual relationship that had a large physical content. Born and out of inconsistency with my personal beliefs and value shame at largely using this sexual partner.
When I deliberately engineered a situation to cause tension between friends to bolster the impression one of them had of me!
Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.
Being harassed for being gay
column2: suggestions of being physically beaten - acting as an informal bouncer in a gay bar.

column1: Landlords put up rents sneakily and slimily.
Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS being prejudiced against at a counselling course on AIDS with 20 others.
Hearing Norman Jones get hysterical in Parliament about law reform (on the radio - listening with 2 others).
Watching Muldoon act as my P.M.
Adolescent guilt growing up feeling bad
column2: immoral sexual desires
column3: some 10yrs ago.

column1: Won a prize for effort.
Assaulted by a drunken neighbour.
I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openly disregarded.
Death of brother.
Reading literature on AIDS/homosexuality.
I am ashamed of myself sometimes when I am working with handicapped people and don't wish to be seen in public with them.
I was late meeting someone for an appointment.
I was feeling really low - had been in a series of fights with my siblings
column2: been under pressure at school and wasn't going to the party I wanted to go - instead
column3: I was going out with my family. A guy called and said
column4: in effect
column5: that I was nice and he liked me. Hence the emotional joy.

column1: I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And light flashed on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre that was almost empty.
My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older than I am
column2: bigger built and stronger I couldn't win in a physical battle and a verbal battle
column3: I couldn't seem to get through to her to hurt her.

column1: My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she was blood. I didn't cry but I was sad
column2: partly due to her death and partly I think because I couldn't/didn't cry.

column1: My older sister used to pick on my brothers and sisters all of whom were younger than her. On one occasion my brother did something my sister didn't like. A full-scale battle began.
My first real experience with a boy. We were alone. I was quite young and pretty naive and he was pretty crude and real
column2: sort of
column3: macho. It was dark
column4: at night during the summer and we were talking.

column1: I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know she wouldn't want me to and I would get into trouble if she found out. But she was only partly justified in forbidding me to use it. She never found out.
Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other friends.
Being alone in Europe and having to catch a train and bus to the airport
column2: then board the plane alone.

column1: At school teacher for not allowing us to go out on New Year's Eve when on a class trip overseas.
I was in a car accident on the way back from a weekend rowing a regatta we'd won. 5 others were in the car. I thought I'd never be able to row again.
Our border burping after meals!
Felt ashamed when in a group conversation and could not understand words or comprehend the topic of discussion.
Guilty when I hadn't walked my dog for quite a few days and had given her no attention.
When I won a position on the track team for the trans-Tasman games when I was eleven.
When I was jumped by three men in a deserted area.
Once a person in authority (a school teacher) was telling blatant lies about me and the headmistress would not let me defend myself. She was also telling lies about other members of my family.
When my mother died.

When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to others who were unable to defend themselves was taken down a few notches and he began to grovel. I was disgusted with his grovelling and how he had treated others.
When I was twelve I was babysitting some children but I did not act very responsibly and one of them was injured.
When something went wrong for me I lashed out at someone else whom I loved and who was not in any way responsible for what had a happened (my sister).
Easter holiday - I had been working weekends and had just left.
Haven't been frightened for ages.

I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a policy of strict positive-negative reinforcement to the children involved. Children who measured up to his standards were made a fuss of - children who didn't were ignored.
I felt sad about the two situations I described before. The cat and the school. Sadness intermingled with the other feelings.
Next door neighbour ran over his cat in the driveway
column2: he tried to finish it off with a flat shovel. I would have taken the cat to a veterinary to either kill it humanely or cure it.

column1: Haven't felt shame for ages.
I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them
column2: she asked for them back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found and returned them.

column1: Getting my kitten
column2: found at work several years ago
column3: taking him home in a box on my motorbike
column4: and showing it to my defacto.

column1: An obscene phone call where the person knew my name.
At work being shifted to another area.
Enrolling at varsity
column2: being told I couldn't get into certain papers.

column1: Noticing my flat had maggots!
A serious drug error while nursing that I knew I was responsible for (the patient lived
column2: no complications
column3: fortunately).

column1: Forgot to turn up on the prescribed day for jury service.
When I was finally able to return to a job that I enjoyed doing after several months of absence (I was not needed during this time).
When I was attacked by a teenage boy and had my wallet stolen.
Someone who was speeding was forced to slow down when I pulled out onto the road and proceeded to abuse me at the next set of traffic lights.
When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and I was unable to see this person because of the situation.
When someone whom I considered my friend
column2: without telling me he was annoyed

column1: When some unforgiving acquaintance dragged up an old and rather embarrassing situation from my past.
When I made a mistake at work and when questioned about it a pretended I had nothing to do with the problem.
At my wedding - standing with the man I love and acknowledging that fact to members of my family and friends.
As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned for guilt.
Arriving home from work after a long and tiring day to find no dinner prepared as I had expected.
At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurred during university examinations and therefore I was unable to attend her funeral.
With a Manager who insists on making crude innuendos about sex.
Cannot remember such a situation.
Breaking the left-hand indicator box by moving too close to a structure.
Waking in the morning (early morning) and having a whole day to myself.
Being driven by a friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little. an It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of the road.
A friend (male) hinted that my talking to other men at a pub was immoral. He implied that I should remain only with my boyfriend for the entire evening.
On rising. No apparent reason.
Prolonged niggling of a friend on a single theme which I considered of no consequence.
I felt I had not appreciated my parents enough. Regretted the problems I'd caused.
Boyfriend doing cleaning in a situation where it was my job to do it. Later snapped at him over a trivial thing. He looked downcast. an I felt guilty - he's just done all that work for me.
When my first niece was born.
In a flat in Sydney - a rough area at home on my own - the flat had been burgled the night before and had no way of locking the door.
When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.
When my uncle died of leukaemia at age 35.
Watching an alcoholic woman who was approaching everyone at the wharf for cigarettes - a prostitute in Auckland (elderly).
Stealing money from my parents when I was young.
Two-timing - going out with 2 guys at once (secretly).
When I went to the pub with a large group of friends
column2: we drank and danced.

column1: Watched a horror movie which involved sexual attacks on women.
My boyfriend promised to take me to see a game of tennis and rang saying he was going to the pub with some of his friends instead.
My mother was unwell and went for many cancer tests. She spent time in the hospital being opened and closed many times.
I was driving along and saw this young guy urinating into the gutter
column2: in broad daylight.

column1: I kicked the dog outside on a cold night because he was annoying me. The next day he came down with the flu and we thought he was going to die.
I spent all weekend with a friend instead of studying for my exams.
Birth of children.
Being alone at night.
In a hurry to get to lectures and the car would not start.
When my grandfather died.
Obscene phone calls.
Being with a close friend
column2: in the city
column3: who was involved at the present point in time in outrageous activity.

column1: Telling white lies.
Thought had discovered true love.

Stopped at lights in Mangere late one Friday night on way home from work. Alone in the car when someone came up behind the car and started banging and shaking it. The light was red and had nowhere to go until the light changed. When green I took off.
When fired unjustly from a job as a casual bar-person. Charged with giving away free drinks. Not done so and had witnesses to prove it - both patrons and bar staff. Other staff were supportive.
Close friends leave to go overseas for an indefinite period. a Farewell scene at the airport.
When the employer made a pass at me whilst I was at work.
When caught shoplifting and the police called the parents and also informed them.
When caught shop-lifting for shame.
Receiving understanding from within myself of a subject I had previously wished to understand better.
To talk in a meeting - expound my thoughts on a subject. Fear delayed me from acting to do this.
The wife's laziness in not performing her usual duties a because of television watching.
Watching suffering in Third World countries.
Observation of people lost in the profit motive - i.e. business managers to their actions esp.
On own reading book. Recall came to mind of slight sexual exploitation of a female (years ago) i.e. had her on even for sexual motives.
Telling a lie to my wife over the phone about what I had been working an at.
Meeting my best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed terribly.
Confronted outside a party by some very nasty character - gesturing to a car full of mean-acting friends - felt in danger.

Having unwanted attention paid to me in my place of work - harassment (and sexual harassment) by another worker - disgusted by his implications.
A close friend discovered I had deceived them. Felt shame at having done it and knowing that they knew.
Two-timing - going out with a person other than the guy I was in a relationship with.

I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist and I thought I was lost and was going to panic.
My parents didn't allow me to go to a social function that all my friends were attending.
While still at school a friend died of cancer
column2: after being ill for a long time
column3: she was 17 yrs old.

column1: At a party
column2: my best girlfriend got drunk and went off with a guy she knows I like.

column1: I was severely reprimanded for a trivial offence in front of members of my peer group while still at school.
Someone asked me to do something and I made up an excuse and said no. I then went and didn't do the same thing with someone else and hoped the first person never found out.
When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years came to visit with his wife which none of our family had previously met.
When I had to give a speech about some historical event
column2: to an audience of about 200 people my age whom I did not know.

column1: In arguments with a close friend or relative where my point of a view is completely disregarded.
When my grandfather whom I had met only once for 3 weeks
column2: died after several months. I was really sad because he was a lovely person and I did not have the means for his company.

column1: I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wildlife films were made and was disgusted by the treatment of certain animals in this particular programme the polar bear.
The 2nd time someone I had met cared for came over to my house I was inebriated and was sick into a bucket.
The first time I went away with my boyfriend and lied about where we were staying.
When my former boyfriend and I reconciled and he decided that I was very important to him. I had always wanted us to get back together again but had doubted the likelihood of this
column2: so I was very happy when my small amount of faith was vindicated.

column1: When riding in a very fastly-driven car on a loose metal road at a very late hour - no other cars on road
column2: and the driver was taking corners very sharply. I felt afraid - because if an accident happened
column3: the area was very isolated. Also
column4: I feared for the driver
column5: and after I was dropped off - would he make it home safely?

column1: When at very short notice I agreed to work in place of a friend who was sick
column2: and the owner of the restaurant refused to allow me a drink later in the evening (which is usually always available for workers)
column3: did not thank me
column4: and was generally indifferent towards me - I felt I did not deserve this.

column1: When I learned that my former boyfriend had become engaged - and although I was glad that he had found what he wanted
column2: I was very sad at my loss
column3: since I had always hoped we might one day reconcile.

column1: When reading a newspaper story of a man who had committed an incestuous act on his two-year-old child - the thought that anyone could do such a thing is abhorrent to me.
When dropping a carton of boiling soup onto a co-worker's leg - a causing great pain
column2: and for me
column3: severe embarrassment at my ineptitude
column4: and shame that another person suffered as a result.

column1: When my sister had the opportunity to do some modelling work. And I was quite jealous - later on
column2: the photographer decided not to take her photograph
column3: and she was very upset - I felt guilty as a result
column4: almost as if I had caused her to lose her opportunity
column5: by not being genuinely happy for her in the first place.

column1: I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot's licence. I can remember it was a gorgeous day and I was on a natural high
column2: cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck and it was a real adventure.

column1: A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Island by ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals - they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All of them were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and were terrified. Eventually
column2: these guys gave up and went looking for us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2 nights.

column1: I cooked the engine in my father's car - it was his fault because he hadn't fixed the temperature gauge or told me. when I finally got home I was screamed at and the anger I experienced was over the injustice of it all plus the huge row which developed.

This sounds predictable and usual but it was heart-rending at the time. My first lover (I was 15) just rang up one day and announced that he had found another woman. I never saw him again and it hurt because I was positive that it was TRUE LOVE !!
I once saw an old man up the road
column2: fossicking through the rubbish bins and the gutter. I was disgusted at first but I have seen him a few times since then and now I feel sorry for him and I often give him cigarettes when I see him because he mainly goes after cigarette butts and it is revolting.

column1: When I was 15 my mother discovered various items in my room that a 15-year-old isn't usually expected to have - mainly alcohol
column2: marijuana and contraceptives!

column1: A holiday at a white-sand deserted beach. A cool evening near the end of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toasted marshmallows
column2: cuddled and drank champagne.

column1: Skiing down a very icy slope
column2: very fast in white-out conditions. an Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I was heading.

column1: My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing and went out with him herself.

I found a baby opossum on the road and took it home and cared for it for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouch an under my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he said they carried diseases.
A boyfriend with whom I split up came over to a friend's house where I was visiting with a male friend. In a confrontation in another room
column2: he tried to find out if I was aroused by my friend by feeling my parts.

column1: I told my primary teacher I hadn't done my homework as my mother was in a car accident. My teacher rang that night to see how my mother was - she was fine i.e. no accident!

Winning a race that I had been training for
column2: for many weeks. a (Running Race).

column2: but they were a close friend and I later regretted it.

Listening to the opening bars of Tchaikovsdy's Symphony No.2 a fourth movement at my sister's wedding.

column2: icy roads

column1: As in sadness (A)

Breaking an implicit promise.
At the age of 12 (or so)
column2: I stole from a Ranger's fruit tree and an apple. (And eventually was compelled to confess - Dostoevsky a would like this).

My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with another close friend of mine.
Sleeping with a girl on a Saturday night and then not contacting her in later days.

Talking with someone I admire a lot.
Held underwater by a large wave and thought I was drowning.

Friends called me fat - pear-shaped in front of a nice girl.
When I considered writing a load of crap for this emotion.
Beating my brother up.

Mugged while on holiday in the U.S.A.

Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years old and a group around us of advances I had made.
A drunk walked out in front of a car at night. Both lower legs were broken. His shoe was thrown about 50 yards after the accident.
My father died 4 years ago

column3: in that she hadn't loved him. I felt ashamed of myself
column4: and of my family.

column1: At the beginning of the year

column1: I read a newspaper article about dogs being stolen to use them for fighting purposes.

Watching a TV documentary on seal clubbing.

I let my pet budgie loose to fly around my room one afternoon. A few hours afterwards I found he was still free and went in and out of my room leaving the door open. My cat got in and killed my budgie - this happened to 3 budgies.
The birth of my first child.
A large german shepherd dog ran and barked at me (he didn't bite

When I as a Pakeha (white) new Zealander
column2: was just as racially prejudiced as other people whom I had condemned.

I was biking with my boyfriend

column1: In a discussion

column1: When my grandmother died. She stayed with us until I had the age an of 10. When she died I was 13 and I remember the moment after the funeral: I sat at the table and cried.
When I heard about the disaster in Bhopal (India).
Once in a public ladies' room
column2: I opened the door of a cubicle that was taken
column3: although it was not locked.

column3: all alone the seesaw fell down with a big smash. My niece got hurt above her eye. Now there is a scar.

column1: When passing the final examinations for a social worker.
Sleeping alone in a tent
column2: while hearing several noises such as rustling etc
column3: I am afraid that there are people who are up to no good.

column3: but he didn't agree for the chair was for his coat.

column1: When my relationship with my girlfriend broke up.

Some weeks ago I experienced a day that everything went wrong I broke several things I felt very ashamed because I am not a sloven.
I had made an appointment with a girl to go to the movies
column2: but actually
column3: I had no mind when we arrived at the cinema
column4: it was a full house. I then went back and she went to the movie alone.

column1: A friend came to tell me that her father invited me to go on a holiday with them in Benidorm otherwise I could not afford to go on holiday.
At the age of 12 years

column1: It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a boyfriend
column2: I had broken the relationship for some reason. a Meanwhile

column1: I saw a terrible accident happen and I laughed a lot at the fright and because I was nervous.

The moment when I heard the result of an examination and it proved that I succeeded in the second year of my study.
I have phobic anxiety about elevators. This anxiety is worst at the moment when the doors have to open. I have it often in the elevator at our university.
When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing to listen to me.
My boyfriend decided to make an end to our relationship.
A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better than she is.
When I am in an auditorium with people and I ask a silly question a so that everyone starts to laugh.

column2: my mother had to be admitted to the hospital because of cardiac complaints. I knew that my move was an important reason for this.

A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel
column2: our relationship finished
column3: mainly because she was not honest. I was very angry about that.

column1: I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.

I was once raped (one year ago) by a man who was a lot older than me and whom I just met. Maybe it wasn't rape but the man wanted more than I wanted to give him since there were other people in the vicinity.
I felt shame when I didn't study enough for my exams and as a result
column2: I failed. I then invented idle stories to talk about it well for myself and others.

I had to unscrew something in my car. I didn't succeed after two afternoons of trying. A feeling of anger built up itself.
Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this
column2: I lost an important source of support
column3: certainty and joyful moments. I cried very intensely when that happened.

During Carnaval I danced for a few minutes normally I don't dance because I am rigid in my moving around during a dance
column2: but I stopped very soon.

column1: I had a girlfriend which I used to call regularly. Then I didn't phone her for a while. At a certain moment

column1: One day

column1: The day I left my first girlfriend.

On a trip to Santander

column1: When I was back home after a long time

My mother always took my side. That brought about quarrels with my father. I knew she didn't like that and I felt very sorry for that.
When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend

column3: stopped

column6: we turned until we came across a man

column1: My father was very angry with me

column1: When I passed the driving test (on the second try).

column2: it looked as if they were looking for something.

I lived together with my boyfriend. One night he stayed away and the next day he told me that he had chatted up with another girl.
I talk too much
column2: and cannot keep things secret. I promised a friend not to tell something to anybody. Nevertheless
column3: I did

column2: I thought it was too negative.

column1: I chatted up with a girl who I didn't love. She
column2: however
column3: was fallen in love with me. I felt responsible for her sorrow.
