column2: I had told them I was going to a party but I went to another place. They were very worried.

column1: Last Summer I achieved something that I had been wanting for a long time.
I was in a camp and went out for a walk at night on my own. I lost my way and spent several hours looking for the camp.
My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done. It was my sister who had done it.
At the hypocrisy of some of my friends.
I greeted and embraced the wrong person thinking that it was a friend.
Due to a misunderstanding on my part
column2: two of my best friends quarrelled.

column1: When my brother was born
column2: everything went all right. It had been very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.

column1: When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until midnight. I had no place to go and there were strange reports at the police station.
When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which I thought I had passed. I had to ask my parents for some more money to carry on studying.
The person whom I liked most left me for a friend of mine
column2: after several months of mutual help and a profound knowledge of each other.

column1: In a park near our home
column2: a group of young people who were strangely dressed were seated in the middle of the street. They began to eat while caressing each other.

column1: I feel this emotion very often when I try to express my feelings in public because other people do not understand my reactions and think that I am silly.
A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely and withdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.
When I passed the university entrance exam. I had thus finished with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one which I had desired a lot.
When I was at home alone
column2: I felt a supernatural force
column3: dangerous for me and the people close to me.

column1: When my father made my mother go through really terrible a situation
column2: I felt furious
column3: impotent
column4: nervous
column5: upset

column1: When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died. I felt empty
column2: lonely
column3: helpless
column4: without support
column5: not knowing what to do.

column1: When I came to know that my father and his parents were: self-interested
column2: dirty
column3: negative
column4: egoist
column5: bad people

column1: I think that the only time I felt shame was when I was very young and I had to defecate on the street. I was very worried in case someone should see me.
When I was young I felt guilty because I thought that I had committed a grave sin.
On my birthday
column2: when I was given my presents.

column1: We were riding in a friend's car. He was driving very fast and suddenly another car crossed the road in front of us. My friend had to turn the car rapidly.
When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the wardrobe. My brother had done it.
When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had failed.
When I was getting up
column2: I found a live cockroach in my bedroom.

column1: The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting on a boy's lap. I tried to greet her but could not help blushing.
A friend of mine had the sleeves of a leather coat stolen from his car. It was me who had left them there for everyone to see.
The final marks were to be given in the morning. I wanted to get there late because I was very afraid. When I arrived there
column2: everybody was very happy and I had also passed. We had a wonderful time all day long.

column1: I went to visit a friend in the hospital. He was going to be operated on the next day. I was afraid that they would not let me in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.
A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the telephone. This friend
column2: crying
column3: called me and I got very angry and made the other person apologize.

column1: A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another girl this Summer. We had been going out together for four years and we had not done so for the last three months. I could not believe it.
I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and vomited.
I was dancing in a theatre. I was not sure whether some friends of mine had come to see me. I was very scared of doing things wrong.
Classes were over and I wanted to go home. A friend of mine asked me to wait for half an hour to take him back home. I said no.
On holiday
column2: seeing the landscape in Gerona.

column1: Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.
They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that the one I had was out of date.
When I came back from my holidays.
When I saw an insect going up my arm.
When I entered a bar looking for a friend.
Arguing with my younger cousin. She is rather a nuisance but I felt sorry.
When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a fortnight.
Once
column2: when I was very young
column3: my mother left me alone in the house and came back very late.

column1: When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and she was fed up with my behaviour.
When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated from them for about three months.
When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.
When the literature teacher made me recite a poem in the middle of the class and I had to gesticulate.
Once
column2: when I arrived home very late
column3: my parents argued a because of this
column4: my mother wanted to stand up for me.

column1: I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in an exam. She told me that I had passed.

I was spending my summer holidays in a village. My friend and I were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise from an alley. We were very scared and we got into my friend's house. A moment later
column2: an unknown car picked up a person from this alley.

column1: My mother and I argued about buying some clothes for me. a She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things as her
column2: and we ended up shouting at each other.

column1: One day
column2: I was home and there was a phone call informing me that some of my relatives had died in an accident.

column1: When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cut to pieces. Above all
column2: it was the blood and the confusion which impressed me most.

column1: I was walking to school and I passed by a red cross post where there were many soldiers. They began to pass remarks at me.
A friend of mine trusted me to back her in a decision she had made. But when the moment came I did not agree with her opinion.
I was told that I had passed the statistics exam. I had not expected this so I was very happy.
When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at sports practice. For some time he could not remember what had happened but he recovered later.
I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something that I do not like. They know this and still do it to tease me.
When my grandfather died.
When opened a box of biscuits and found worms inside.
When I was young I was told to the shop to buy a dozen eggs. a I went and asked for one egg and the people in the shop laughed at me and so did my family when I told them what had happened.
When I arrived home late at night. I know that my mother gets worried and this made me feel angry.
When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck with the examinations she was about to take.
When I was told that my daughter
column2: who is at a boarding school
column3: was very ill and that they needed me there the same day.

column1: One day in a clinic
column2: the father of a child came in and assaulted a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.

column1: When I was told that my uncle had passed away.
The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the driver made the same excuse every day.
One day when I came back home
column2: I found my favourite dish broken. an I blamed the servant for it
column3: later I found out that it was not a servant but my daughter who had broken it.

column1: When I did not give back a textbook to a friend in time.
When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after a long illness. I had thought that this illness would never end.
When a man who had a knife grabbed me and threatened me with it
column2: during my holidays in Monze.

column1: A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent way for no apparent reason. It may be that he was excited about something.
When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by thieves in Kabwe. They stole his van.
When we were young
column2: a friend of mine tried to dissect a frog while we were playing near his home.

column1: The time I shouted at most of my friends at a party. It was as if all my friends had done something wrong
column2: or maybe it was the influence of the beer.

column1: When I blamed my niece for misplacing my book
column2: she denied having touched or seen it but I carried on insisting that it was her.

column1: After going through much shame
column2: I became a Christian and something new happened in my heart. The joy that overflows was manifest in me.

column1: When I was about six years old
column2: I mistook a cat for a leopard when it entered my room at night.

column1: When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him a Mister. I refused to succumb
column2: but he persisted and I got angry as he had belittled me.

column1: When I lost my father on the 25th of September
column2: 1970. He died of a sore on the leg.

column1: When I failed grade 7 twice and only passed it the third time.
I was going around with a foreigner's wife and my entire family a got to know about it
column2: this was just when I had become a Christian.

column1: When they found out that I was absent from school
column2: I had gone to a girls' secondary school.

column1: When I first passed a job interview.
I was almost caught in the girl's hostel by the security men
column2: I would have been expelled from school had I been caught.

column1: When I was accused of having refused to do some hostel work while I was at school. I had not been allocated any work.
A friend of mine could not make it back to Unza after having failed the exams.
I usually come back home early but this day I came home back late to find some visitors at my place.
I got passing marks in the H.S.S compulsory courses while most people performed well.
I destroyed my step-brother's bedsheets by mistake
column2: they were the only ones he had.

column1: When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.
When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who had a gun.
When a friend tried to backbite me on false grounds. This made me wonder if he was a really good friend.
When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.
When someone whom I trusted
column2: disappointed me terribly.

column1: I was with my colleagues and we met an elderly man who was very drunk
column2: as he approached us he started to undress.

column1: When I lied to my mum
column2: who later came to know that what I had been telling her was false.

column1: When I hooked a girl in Kitwe. She was very beautiful to my standard
column2: a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.

column1: When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.

When I was victimized for running away with a girl who was somebody else's wife and niece at the same time. I was very angry over this issue because I was told to pay him money after having been punished for it.

column2: the Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's reaction to the student's demands concerning the educational system.

column1: When I got a grade of C in M160 at the end of my first year at Anza. I had expected a C+ or a B as M160 is easy
column2: going by my capacity in mathematics.

column1: When I was found urinating
column2: behind a toilet instead of inside it
column3: by my classmates and the teachers. I was told to pick up my urine from the wet soil
column4: I did it.

column1: When my uncle found me having sexual intercourse with a distant relative of mine in the sitting room
column2: on the couch. I failed to stop and get up
column3: I carried on.

column1: When I was accepted for further education
column2: here at the university.

column1: When I was walking at night
column2: I saw fire suspended in the air and it was split into several segments by something I could not see. an I suspected that it was a witch-craft.

column1: When I was accused by my brother of having stolen a 5 kwacha note from my mother's bag. I was beaten up for this
column2: and the money was found later.

column1: When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill and was in the hospital.
When I was refused a transfer from my school to another
column2: simply because it was far away from my house.

column1: When I was taking an exam in grade 5. The examinator found me with a notebook and accused me of copying
column2: All the students laughed at me.

column1: When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.
When I got first division in the exams before leaving school.
When I went to town on a double-decker bus. The bus was about to fall on the way when the driver controlled it. It had almost fallen.
When I was in form 3
column2: my aunts lied to my dad telling him that I had told them that I was pregnant. My dad told my mother and she asked me if it was true. I was very angry with my aunts.

column1: When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.
When a drunkard
column2: in town yelled at me saying that I was a prostitute.

column1: My brother came to see me and found me with a boyfriend. When my boyfriend greeted him
column2: he did not answer and instead started shouting at me and scolding me in the presence of my boyfriend.

column1: When I went to my roommate's drawer to see if she had an iron which I could use
column2: she came in. I felt guilty as she may have thought that I had been stealing.

column1: When I had my four children.
When two of my children were critically ill with measles.
When I got a low grade in an administration course.
When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.
When my mother betrayed me by obtaining money from my husband when we were separated - pending divorce.
When I gave my boyfriend a brush-off.
When I beat up my son for having beaten up his sister.
This happened when I went to check my first-year results
column2: I had thought that I would fail and I found that I had a clear pass in all my courses.

column1: When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed a -rooms. I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.
When a friend of mine was trying to make a fool out of me.
I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and its problems.
When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime minister
column2: Indira Gandhi.

column1: When I got drunk at a party and made a fool of myself by vomiting all over the place and insulting the people who were there with me.
When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after having gone to a disco without permission.
When I was told that I had passed the exams.
When a thief broke into my house at night.
When my sister broke my china tea set.
I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.
I met my best friend's husband with a prostitute.
When I failed to answer a simple question.
My brother wanted money but I refused to give it to him
column2: two days later he stole it from my father.

column1: When I learnt that I was selected for form I.
When I was nearly beaten up by the brother of my girlfriend.
When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and looking down at me.
When a friend
column2: who has been with me at school
column3: failed to make it to UNZA.

column1: When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested in me.
I choked on a cold drink in front of girls who were strangers.
When I was caught with my girlfriend in the house at night.
When I passed the grade 7 exam.
When I was told by the doctor
column2: after many months of coughing
column3: a that I had tuberculosis.

column1: When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets
column2: put water in it and threw it in the dust-bin.

column1: This happened when one of my uncles died just when I was planning to go and visit him during the next holidays.
When I realized that my closest friend had said bad things about me when I was not around and had betrayed me by making friends with my boyfriend's other girl.
When five of my friends at the secondary school found out the bad things that I had been saying about them.
When my mother returned from a holiday
column2: I told her a lie i.e my father had brought another woman home while she was away.

column1: At the time I qualified to enter secondary school.
One evening I saw the old guard man I knew
column2: change into something inhuman for about 5-10 seconds
column3: this frightened me.

column1: When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidentally gave a fake coin at a counter. I realized this before I handed over the coin
column2: but the man called me a thief and called a witness.

column1: The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had been eaten by the neighbour's dogs. It had been locked out by my wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.
The day I was forced to use a public convenience place in town. an It was so filthy that it made me sick.
My mother caught me stealing some food when I was a young boy.
When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out
column2: it was killed by the dogs.

column1: I felt joy when I came to know Christ. That is when I became a Christian.
When I broke the window pane of my next-door neighbour's house.

When I heard that my nephew had passed away.
When my father thought that I was an unreliable son.
When I stole a book in class and the teacher caught me
column2: the rest of the class laughed at my attempt.

column1: When I insulted an elderly person for no reason.
When my uncle gave me my first year's results. I opened the envelope and my eyes ran into two B+ - in EC110 and M160
column2: this meant that I had qualified for a major in economics.

column1: I turned the knob of my granny's two-band radio and did not hear any broadcast
column2: What! Have I broken the knob? How much does it cost? What if the spare part is not available?  --I did not know how to tune a radio.

column1: I peeped into Maurine's bedroom and saw two people - Maurine and my stepdad. I thought
column2: Why did she break her promises? Why had she invited me? Why do old men go for young girls?

column1: When I missed the chance of becoming a graduate in mining engineering
column2: after having prayed for one week in the church I was not even selected.

column1: I stormed into the room
column2: hoping to cool myself with some soft music from my three-band radio cassette. There was only young a Kaley there and he explained
column3: Your aunt has sold it as she wanted to buy clothes.

column1: When a lady I was flirting with told all my classmates that she was in the second year while I was in the first year
column2: everyone laughed and started looking at me.

column1: My cousin knocked on the door
column2: looking for me to get her to watch back. I had given it to my girlfriend
column3: Lizzy
column4: as a present.

column1: This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposal and everything went smoothly
column2: just as I had wanted it to. It was contrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about her response.

column1: It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan
column2: he wanted to grab me and take me to his kingdom. He was very repulsive and I have never seen anything like that before.

column1: This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my trousers without my consent.
When I failed a test at my primary school. I was then in grade 7 and we were about to take the main exam.
This was when I saw
column2: for the first time
column3: a naked woman (prostitute) running away from a house after having been discovered by the guardian.

column1: This was when I was discovered stealing a piece of bread at home
column2: and I was very hungry a few hours before supper.

column1: When I was afraid to tell my sports teacher at secondary school a that I had not participated in the sports activities the previous day.
I was in grade 7. We had an inter-house volleyball competition. In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored the winning goal using my head. I jumped up with joy and fell.
I was escorting a relative on a bike
column2: we passed by a dark road with bushes on each side. Halfway down this road
column3: suddenly
column4: we saw a white dog appear from one side. Before we could do anything
column5: it had vanished and it did not seem to have any legs.

column1: The comrade staying next door insulted me for what he called a misuse of his iron. He called me stupid
column2: self-centred etc. and I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining school to cool off.

column1: A close relative was at odds with a very powerful firm. All his things had been taken
column2: His dad had died a little before this event. He gathered his children and vowed to give them a good life with a new start - the words were hollow
column3: and he bit back his tears.....I asked to be excused and then went and cried in the loo.

column1: A pig in the well from which we drink.
My girlfriend had started going around with another boy. Her cousin
column2: also a friend of mine
column3: asked her who she preferred. Both of us were present and she chose the other guy.

column1: I bumped my dad's car into a lamppost. He was not at home then
column2: a neither was he home when I left for the campus. I did not tell him about the accident and I will never tell him.

column1: I was at school when I received a letter from the dean of my school congratulating me on my performance in the previous year's exam.
This was at secondary school
column2: a perfectly framed up some case and a took it to the deputy headmaster. I was called by the headmaster and he threatened to suspend me.

column1: When I travelled to my former school to collect my certificate
column2: only to be told that I owed them some money
column3: I knew nothing about this.

column1: My sister was in the hospital
column2: and later in the evening
column3: we received the information that she had died.

column1: When at school I thought that I was going to get the best results in mathematics
column2: but it was someone else who got the prize.

column1: When I received a letter from my girlfriend telling me that she was engaged to another man.
I felt guilty when I heard the results of my friend
column2: who had failed. I wished that I had helped him.

column1: My being admitted to UNZA.
While paddling in the river during a storm. I feared drowning.
I entrusted a friend with the delivery of some money to my father
column2: however
column3: he misused the money.

column1: The loss of my mother.
Over an argument.
At school - being whipped by the teacher in front of the class.
When I had a sufficient amount of money
column2: I brought more clothes for myself than for the children - I felt bad about it.

column1: My first kiss.
When I saw a ghost.
My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.
When a friend left me and went back home for good.
When I failed an exam.
Insulted my girlfriend during a pep talk.
I caught a close relative with the servant of the house.
When I passed my form three exams.
The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (form a four).
When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talking behind my back.
When I heard about the death of my aunt.
When my brother promised me money but he failed to fulfil the promise.
I was running in front of a crowd when I slipped and fell on a wet lawn.
When I took drugs.
As the time to get the results drew near I became more and more anxious. My friend called me and said
column2: You have passed. My heart was full of joy.

column1: I watched a very terrifying film in LT2. This film pushed my heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before the second reel ended.
I have been hearing rumours that you have not been allowing people in your room
column2: he said. This sentence shot my heart. I failed to find the right words
column3: instead
column4: I walked away without uttering a word.

column1: One Saturday morning I got ready to go out swimming with my friends. Unfortunately
column2: the weather did not permit it
column3: so we stayed indoors.

column1: One day I went to town to get my grocery. On my way back
column2: I took a minibus which was full of drunk students. I felt very disgusted.

column1: I had gone to a bookshop to buy some books. Somehow
column2: I got very cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought. an I lost my temper and screamed at him. Later I felt very ashamed of myself as a lot of people I know were there.

column1: I remember deceiving my brother
column2: I told him that I was going to attend the Sunday service
column3: instead
column4: I went out to the town with a friend.

column1: When I heard that a close relative of mine had given birth at a very young age
column2: in a very remote area and had had very few problems.

column1: The possibility of having failed the examination.
When someone chased me from his house.
When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a student like me.
When some people
column2: including me
column3: are treated in a way which equates them to an animal or a thing.

column1: When someone I know was caught in an adultery situation.
When I did something wrong in the past and denied having done it when asked about it later.
My girlfriend wrote to me telling me that she was four months pregnant and that I was responsible for the damages. This made me happy as I longed to have a child to call mine.
The shooting started and we all lay down to protect ourselves from the flying bullets. This incident occurred on our way to a Feira
column2: during the Zambia army patrols in the Rhodesia war.

column1: I went to the dining hall and found that the cooks were cleaning the plates and there was no food for me
column2: and the bluebirds (security guards) were busy eating the food that was supposed to be for me.

column1: That afternoon I received two messages informing me
column2: that my brother was in a coma in the U.T.H. suffering (from kidney disease) and two
column3: that my uncle met with an accident on his way to the hospital to see my brother.

column1: This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and a found him screwing my girlfriend.
When I walked out of my room with only my pants on and found my girlfriend and her female friend looking for me outside.
My father caught me having sexual intercourse with my closest cousin. There was nothing wrong with it but the female was too old for me.
When a girl I wanted very much
column2: said yes and fell in love with me.

column1: One evening
column2: when I had gone fishing with my friends
column3: we heard a roar of a lion nearby and had to run for our lives.

column1: When somebody stole my brother's disco machine.
When my uncle died.
A classmate answered (accidentally) the call of nature in the class during a tough mathematics examination.
I was double-crossing my fiancee and one day she caught me red-handed. She forgave me later. I was very ashamed of what I had done.
I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for it
column2: and I was caught red-handed.

column1: I was very happy when I discovered that I had passed my first-year examination and was among the thirty students who would major in economics.

I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen. I was in a panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to be considered for the economics quota. I cried a lot but that did not help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.
I was annoyed this particular day as it seemed that the odds were not in my favour. My grandfather added fuel to the fire when I had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.
It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my sister had passed away. The news had been hidden from me so that I could take my exams.
When I discovered that my mother had been involved in adultery.
I was caught stealing food at my aunt's place. I had tried to hide the food I had taken from the pantry while my aunt was in the kitchen
column2: however
column3: she went to the pantry and discovered the stolen package.

column1: Dad had just married his second wife (my stepmother) and I did not like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to her dresses. Everyone suspected my brother and he had to bear the consequences. Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had done it.
When I was accepted at UNZA.
When I heard a lion roar for the first time.
When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with our discussion. This friend failed in the 7th grade
column2: what made me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.

column1: When my beloved grandfather died.
I was disgusted at the university wanting some of us to travel from our homes to the lectures here every day. The way the whole thing was handled disgusted me.
When I was leaving home I decided to leave without saying goodbye to my young brother. My brother saw me and said
column2: Will you not say goodbye to me? He is only 31/2 years old.

column1: When I cheated my father about the book allowance at university. a He discovered that we were given K150 per year for books.
I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to the second year.
When I was going home
column2: I saw something which looked like a snake on the road but later I found out that it was only a stick.

column1: This happened recently
column2: I was in the dining hall and one of my friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.

column1: I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away. She was the last of my grandparents to pass away.
This happened when I could not get into the school I had initially wanted and ended up doing something I had never thought I would do.
I insulted the girl to whom I had proposed when she turned me down.
My mother had sent me to buy a few things. The change I brought back was not right as I had given away some money to a friend thinking that she would not notice it. However
column2: my mother told me that the change was not correct.

column1: When my first child was born.
I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at a distance of about four metres.
When my daughter began staying away from classes - at the age of nine only.
When my wife died in the hospital
column2: she was pregnant and had undergone an operation.

column1: When my best friend started getting involved in my private affairs.
I was very drunk at a certain wedding party and I got involved in a fight.

I send a word to my boss through my servant telling him that I would not report for work as I was not feeling well and that the doctor had refused to give me sick leave. My intention was actually to go out of Lusaka for a weekend. I left the same day and the following morning my boss found me in Mongu. I felt guilty when asked to explain things on my return.
I received a letter of acceptance from UNZA.
We were driving at night and I realized that a car was following us.
I reached home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.
I saw a dead child which was not covered
column2: it had been knocked down by a car.

column1: I saw a friend's husband with another woman.
I scolded my sister without waiting for her explanation.
I accused my husband of being late deliberately when he came to pick me up from work.
When I was appointed by the Ministry of Health to join the teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.
When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and urine for some other examination
column2: he told me that something bad would happen to me as he would play magic on me.

column1: When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was occupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full-time student at UNZA.
When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away instantly. He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to wait at his home so that I could see his new car.
When I was told that the brother who was staying with me would not go to the training school that year but only the year after.
A patient
column2: to whom I had given a powerful medicine
column3: shouted at me in front of many people. I realized that he did so because he was very ill.

column1: When I broke up my relationship with my former girlfriend as she would ask me irrelevant questions about my past.
When I received my promotion letter.
I was sleeping when I heard the neighbours screaming
column2: I peeped through the window and saw a thief trying to enter my neighbour's house.

column1: I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular job was not done
column2: it was not my job to do it.

column1: My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the family. I felt sad because I thought that if my mother had not gone away when this brother was younger
column2: things would have been different.

column1: I was on a train when a woman started talking loudly and attracting everybody's attention. The worst thing was that she was discussing something
column2: about which she knew nothing
column3: with another person.

column1: After a jogging session
column2: I had severe abdominal cramps and this led to my wanting to empty my bladder. My friends gathered around me and two of them had to help me to the toilet. I was ashamed of having to go to the toilet in the presence of my friends.

column1: A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept putting it off. When I finally made it
column2: I did not see her for a day only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died. I felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do what she had requested me to do.

column1: When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former secondary school.
I had gone for a medical check-up at the U.T.H. and failed to make it back on time for the C119 practical sessions at 1400 hours a last academic year.
When I was mistreated by my stepmother.
When my aunt passed away in early 1982.
When I failed to secure employment after my form 5 in Lusaka despite my excellent certificate.
When I failed my grade 7 exam on the first attempt in 1975. My father and the entire family thought that I was finished in life. an I felt like hiding.
When I beat up a first-year student at my secondary school in my capacity as the deputy head boy. He had woken up late in the morning for manual work.
When I heard that someone very close to me did very well in the exams despite having fooled around a lot.
When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had run to get away from him. We were all alone and all I could see was this hand coming towards me.

When a friend and I played a joke on our boyfriends. Her boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend. He embarrassed me in front of a crowd.
When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather. We had seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been waiting to see us.
When a boy put a handful of cooked potatoes down my dress and there was no water to clean up.
When a soppy poem that I had written to a boy was found and everyone read it and started teasing me about it.
When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused because I wanted to go out with another guy. I did go out and my boyfriend found out.
After a long time (of no communication with him
column2: physical illness and worry) my lover came to see me when I least expected to see him.

column1: Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying and flapping their wings in the bedroom at night. It was very dark and I could not even see my nose. I did not know that it was the birds till my mother told me so.
The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and make a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by the prefect who was my classmate and was very cool and dull.
My elder sister scolded me in front of my younger sisters and cousins. She said that I was very lazy and I felt so sad that I cried myself to sleep.
On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirt on
column2: he danced
column3: spoke nonsense and behaved stupidly.

column1: When I wet my bed at boarding school.
My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get her on my back
column2: she slipped and fell.

column1: My son was registered to get admission in grade one of primary school. The chances of him getting a place there were 1/10. Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.
When I came back from work one day
column2: the friends of my son told me that he had not come back from school and that he was lost.

column1: My roommate locked up our room without specifying where I would find the keys. I had to spend several hours in my other friend's room.
I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much. I had not known that he had been ill for a very time when I received this message he was already dead.

The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questions going from a to e for each question. She asked me to do all this in one and a half hours. It involved a lot of describing and explaining and even though I knew all the answers
column2: I could not finish the work.

column1: I forgot that the course instructor had directed us to go to a special class after the usual class hours. I missed this the first day and when he asked me about it the next day I said that I had forgotten.

I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been spotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front. an I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into this a neighbour's house.
When my father bought me a suit.
After having taken an exam I feared having failed it.
I was badly beaten up by one of my friends during a wedding party.
I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.
I was disappointed by a girlfriend when I visited her at her home in Woodlands.
I was ashamed of being the only one to have got a C+ in ED120 as an assignment.
I was caught stealing a box of matches in the supermarket and had to plead guilty.
When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.
When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I would find here and the kind of behaviour they would have towards me.
I had gone home for a weekend and when I came back I found that my clothes and my bedding had been stolen.
When my father passed away.
Someone stole a K10 note and the teacher thought that it was me when I was not responsible for the theft.
When I failed the grade seven exams.
One day my mother went to visit her friends. When she came back she scolded me for not having kept the house in order
column2: so I decided not to talk to her.

column1: When I saw my family after a separation of one year.
When my little sister was sick at home and I thought that she would die.
When I found out that my sister had been playing with my confidential things which she had taken from my handbag.
When one of my best friends committed suicide during these holidays.
I am disgusted at the number of second-year students who are pregnant illegitimately.
When I got very low marks on one of the assignments.
When my aunt went out of her way to help me out with my financial problems.
When I fell in love with X. Overnight I felt confident
column2: self-esteem
column3: responsible and worthwhile.

column1: When a thunder belt hit the rooftop of the building I was in.
When my roommate locked me out deliberately
column2: before an exam due at 1400 hours.

column1: When my friends died one after the other. The first died in a car accident and the second one recently
column2: due to an illness.

column1: When my cousin put faeces in my washing. A silly idea which was meant to be a joke.
Getting drunk and creating a lot of trouble at a place I respect - my friend's home.
When I took a small boy's share of chocolate. He was our guest and so had been given a larger share of the sweets.
The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for a B.An at UNZA. I felt happy because I had not expected to be selected.
The day I encountered a queer mamba face to face in a chunk of leaves behind our house.
When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship with certain other friends which they thought was improper.
The day my teacher of Latin and French died.
The day I went to eat dinner in the dining hall and found a dead fly in my gravy.
I felt ashamed of myself the first time I drank as nobody in the family drinks. I felt that I had let down my parents and my friends.
The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.
I was very happy when I received the year-end results as I was worried about how well I had done. I was very happy to know that I had passed.
I was caught doing something I was not supposed to do. I did something with the person who caught me (bribe) and even though he promised not to report me
column2: I am still frightened.

column1: I told my friend something confidential which was supposed to remain between the two of us. The next thing that happened was that a girl who is not even close to us came laughing and asked me to tell her about it. I was very angry with my friend as I had trusted her.
I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.
When thieves broke into our house
column2: I was disgusted by their behaviour. They did not find anything so they broke things like the windows
column3: glasses etc.

column1: When I bribed the person who caught me doing something I was not supposed to have done. I was very ashamed of what I had done.
I was caught doing something bad and I bribed the person who caught me. Later I felt very bad
column2: maybe I should have paid for my bad behaviour.

column1: When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my registration at UNZA.
I was a passenger in a vehicle when suddenly another vehicle came from behind to overtake us. However
column2: another one was coming right in front so the other vehicle changed course and blocked our way and so we crashed against the side of the road.

column1: I was asked to stop studying economics
column2: a field which interested me
column3: by my employers.

column1: When I learnt of the death of a friend.
When I learnt that my offer to study at the university had been a withdrawn and so I would not get hostel accommodation at UNZA
column2: even though I registered as a student later.

column1: My love proposal was turned down by a lady I loved.
I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and asking for money
column2: though I had some money I did not give him anything.

column1: When I first came to the campus.
When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock. an I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the gallows.
When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towards another friend turned into a quarrel.  I lost my temper and nearly knocked him out.
When I lost my father in a car accident.
When I was denied my favourite dish at the dining hall (Shima a with roast chicken)
column2: I felt disgusted.

column1: I felt ashamed when a friend
column2: whom I had always respected
column3: insulted me in public. He was drunk.

column1: When my library books were overdue and I did not have the money to pay for them.
When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams. I had not expected to do so well.
When I was an exploration with my friends and almost got lost in an unfamiliar environment. It was getting dark and we did not know how to get back home.
When my father did not get back from Chipata on time
column2: he was thus a holding back progress as everything depended on him. I felt angry over his actions.

column1: When my little brother passed away mysteriously
column2: at least from what I was told about it.

column1: When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train
column2: just off a Kafue. The woman had been cut to bits
column3: there was blood and splinters of bone everywhere.

column1: When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and myself.
When I passed out a female friend of mine for no apparent reason. I was under the influence of drugs and when I am like that I get mad at anyone
column2: however small the provocation.

column1: When I was accepted at UNZA.
When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard gunshots.
When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for. A boy had come to our gate asking for me
column2: my aunt went out to see him. I had neither met nor known the boy.

column1: When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a murder).
When my mother got a terrible beating from my father. It was so bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized how bad it was.
When my friend had a child out of wedlock.
When I lay at home.  I told them that I was going to a Christian meeting and I went to see my boyfriend instead.
Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.
When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary school. His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it. The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel us.
At boarding school
column2: someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed. When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my inability to find out my enemies. I lost my temper.

column1: When my grandfather died.
My roommate was drunk
column2: he vomited on the floor and fell face down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death. Then he fainted and so I called first aid.

column1: As a kid my mother caught me stealing sugar and giving it to a neighbour.
I got into a bad fight in a bar and my friend received a bad cut above his left eye while trying to separate us.
I felt very happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies. I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.
I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money. an I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.
A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to marry him. The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not leave her alone.
When my sister died
column2: she was only sixteen when she was put to rest.

column1: When I witnessed an accident.
When my father found me in bed with a girl
column2: we were deep in action when he entered the room.

column1: I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked if it was me who had taken the money
column2: I denied it.

column1: When I won some coins in a small competition.
I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights were off. I got inside the gate and just then I realized that the dogs may be outside.
My little niece
column2: who is very talkative
column3: suddenly became very naughty and began wetting her pants. She did it one afternoon.

column1: This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that somebody was attacking me. I started crying in my sleep and then my roommate woke me up.
When I learnt that my cousin's sister was pregnant.
My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drank like fools and made a lot of noise. We drank too much wine.
The fridge we had at home had a lock. One day when I wanted something
column2: I unscrewed the door but unfortunately
column3: I was caught in an act.

column1: When I was selected for the university.
When I saw an accident
column2: a woman was run over and she died on the spot.

column1: When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my wardrobe.
When my grandmother passed away.
While watching a movie
column2: someone who was drunk started vomiting helplessly.

column1: When I ate my sister's food and then she found out that it was me. I felt very ashamed but still refused to admit that it was me.
When I told a person something that had happened to my friend
column2: a and this person went and told my friend.

column1: When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a long time.
When I was told that the form five results were out.
When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not know.
The time I lost a badminton match
column2: that I should have won at Zambia closed badminton championships.

column1: When I was taking my girlfriend out
column2: she seemed to have taken her time.

column1: When my dad caught me with a honey (girlfriend) in my bedroom.
When I beat up a stupid boy who was fond of cracking jokes about me.
When I was selected for higher education
column2: i.e grade 7 to form.

column1: When I impregnated a certain girl
column2: I thought that I would be forced to marry her or go to court.

column1: When the university withdrew the accommodation that it had given me.
When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation and they are together now).
When I patronized a certain tavern which had prostitutes
column2: it was almost a brothel.

column1: When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.
When I sided with my mother in a quarrel she had with my father before they briefly separated.
When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever cared for me. This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to learn that it was me who was delaying things.
Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them would be killed.
When I could not reason with my friend
column2: it angered me.

column1: I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead mother and was calling her by her name. I was sad.
I feel disgusted at not having got an A in yesterday's practicals of G220.
I felt very ashamed at having got a book by force from a girl.
I felt guilty about having suspected my roommate of stealing the money last term.
Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our surprise
column2: she had a baby 2 months back.

column1: My uncle was taken to the UTC for an operation as he had cancer. a There had been a lot of deaths of late - 3 out of every 4 operated. I was scared for my uncle's life.

I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and 1/2 hours. It was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who had the money. Finally
column2: I borrowed some money from friends and we went to town. I was angry with my friend.

column1: I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school. I was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my friend. That day I was really sad.
I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when my brother came home he ate it all. I was disgusted about it.
We were at a party
column2: this guy I liked and me. I loved him and gathered enough courage to ask him to kiss me. He did not do it but instead asked me what I would like for my birthday. I told him that I would like a kiss more than anything else but he excused himself and said that it was impossible. I felt embarrassed.

column1: We were at secondary school and I was making a lot of noise. The teacher came to ask us who was making all the noise. I did not own up so the whole class was punished.
I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA was approved after it had been cancelled.
When I met an elephant in the bush.
When someone took my pen away.
When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home. He fell ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.
An officer at the Dean of Students' office had promised to give me a room the next day
column2: but he failed to keep his promise.

column1: I do not have accommodation on campus so I stay with my extended family
column2: one young man used bad words while asking me to leave their home.

column1: I broke a glass of glycerine at the Z.C.B.C store in Ndola.
When I was with someone I love.
When I was walking around all alone at night.
Being made to look like a fool by a girl.
When my dad passed away.
When I was told that I had no right to control my lover.
Getting very low marks in mathematics.
When one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.
At my sister's wedding.
When I had to walk along a dark road alone.
When I was locked out of my room by my roommate's friend.
When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of Zambia.
When I found out that someone close to me was flirting around.
When I swindled money out of someone.
I did not deliver a message on time.
When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my lover and future wife.
When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be heard.
When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.
The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my grade six.
When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged after I had learnt all the lines.
When a woman who I respected very much was made pregnant
column2: unexpectedly by a man of a calibre I never expected.

column1: When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance later I thought that I would be found out.
I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last born in the family.
My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago. I was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay unconscious in hospital for two weeks.
I felt very angry when a beads seller robbed me of the transport money I had to go to school.
I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and could not be accepted at the institution of learning.
I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him. I had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.
I was ashamed when my friend and I were crossed with each other a till we apologized to each other.
I felt guilty when I said bad things to my sister
column2: I had not intended to do so. She cried a lot and later she fell ill and I felt responsible for her illness.

column1: When I was selected to study here at UNZA.

column2: I was going to a school which was near my village and I met a lion on the way
column3: which disappeared suddenly.

column1: When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.
When I heard of the death of my mother.
When my relatives troubled me I would help them financially.
When I failed one of the first year's courses.
When I was late for work and told my boss that it was due to a transport problem
column2: the truth was that I had woken up late. I thus cheated my boss.

column1: I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter to UNZA. This happened again when I passed all my first-year courses.
In 1977 when my friend was caught by a crocodile. We were swimming in a river on whose banks our primary school was situated. When my friend was caught
column2: he was on the banks of the river and some of us were still in the middle of the river. I was very frightened.
I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating up his old father. He claimed that the father was responsible for his guardian's failure.

column1: Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had passed away. I felt lonely and bad because apart from the biological ties
column2: he was a good old friend of mine at home.

column1: Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine
column2: who is now in a different school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence. He was drunk and he vomited in my room. I was unhappy.

column1: A few years back I had proposed love to a girl who later turned out to be related to me. Though we were in love with each other
column2: we both felt ashamed and withdrew from each other.

column1: Last year I was asked to look after my niece while her mother was cooking. Unfortunately
column2: the kid fell off the bed
column3: I was confident that she would not fall and had not been paying much attention.

column1: When I qualified for form I. I was one of the three pupils who qualified for form I that year.
When I learnt that the girl I had impregnated was in the hospital and was on the verge of dying as she had refused to accept the responsibility of her pregnancy and had wanted to commit suicide.
When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few days earlier.
When I lost my grandmother. She had been my guardian after the death of my father.
When my demand for accommodation on the campus was refused and the rooms were allotted to first-year students who were from Rucher and came from influential families.
When I told a girl that I could not take her out that night as I was entertaining my mother who had come from home. However
column2: I later met this girl with another girlfriend at a hostel where I had taken out another girlfriend of mine.

column1: When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss that it was not me who was responsible for the delay. The boss was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary was taken away from him.
When my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.
When burglars with guns forced themselves into my house and ordered me to give them money or face death.
When my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.
When my elder brother died.
When my friend
column2: after a beer spree vomited in my sitting room.

column1: When I was taken to the place where my uncle had defecated in his pants after having a drunk beer.
When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work a place
column2: this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.

column1: When my brother gave me a watch.
When the front tyre of the car burst.
When I was insulted by a fellow student.
When the girl I loved turned me down.
When I found my girl in bed with another man.
When I failed grade 7.
When I was caught going out with another girl by my girlfriend.
When I passed the first year I could come back for my second year.
I was working at a certain place and every day after work dad would come to pick me up. One day he did not come
column2: it started getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very
column3: very far away.

column1: One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had objected to in the beginning
column2: however
column3: he visited me and convinced me to come. On the day of the appointment
column4: I had to wait for him for over an hour.

column1: When my grandmother passed away. We had been waiting for it as she had been sick for years
column2: but when it happened I found it hard to accept.

column1: When my grandmother came to stay with us permanently as she is a very difficult person to stay with and when she started telling false stories about us to other people.
When I realized that I was pregnant. I thought about what my relatives and friends would think about me and I felt a lot of self-pity.
One day when I was working
column2: I went out for dinner with friends without my parent's knowledge and I only came home at 2300 hours.

column1: I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying colours and that I had made it to the university.
Last night
column2: I dreamt that things that looked like monsters were trying to kiss me.

column1: One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I was sure that I had done no such thing.
The passing away of my mum.
One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.
About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there was nothing wrong with me.
This is a kind of confession - my mum found me stealing meat from a pot.
The first time I fell in love with a girl.
The time I drove my uncle's car
column2: without having asked for his permission. It was the first time that I was driving a car.

column1: When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.
When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a car accident.  He was bringing me a present as I had passed my form five exams with flying colours.
When I
column2: for the first time
column3: failed a junior exam
column4: i.e form 3.

column1: When my mum learnt that I had beaten up someone in a fight.
When I nearly got my fiancee pregnant.
When my sister's first child came home
column2: after one week in intensive care at the hospital.

column1: When I was at a boarding school in Lusaka
column2: the Rhodesian soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the whole scene.

column1: A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to medical a school. Her grades were very good and she should not have been left out. Biased judgment!
My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephew) and then an older one died a week later.
When I went to report a stolen good at the police station
column2: the woman-officer-in-charge was very rude and did not seem to have respect for anyone.

column1: I insulted two of my friends because I thought that had been gossiping about me right under my nose
column2: however
column3: I later found out that they were not doing so.

column1: I failed to keep a promise and this had a serious effect on someone's problem.
When I met my mother after not having seen her for three years.
When my neighbour's life was threatened by someone who was trying to break into his house.
When a drunk boy came into my room and misbehaved in the presence of my boyfriend.
My father resigned from work
column2: and soon after this
column3: his elder brother died. The next day my granny died (my mother's mother). My dad remains the only living member of his family.

column1: When the committee
column2: to which I belong
column3: was accused of having squandered the money of the association.

column1: When I went to the library three weeks after it had opened and a found that everyone was busy.
When my friend was punished for something that I had done.
For my parent's anniversary
column2: we hosted a party and we were very happy.

column1: One evening when my sisters
column2: brothers and I were watching TV my kid brother took a big mirror and reflected light on the french windows. I thought that these lights that we could see were coming from torches and that it meant that there were thieves outside.

column1: Some people were sitting outside and saying things which were not true.
A break-up with someone I liked.
I came across a woman in town who was very drunk. She was swearing at everyone and carried on drinking even though she could hardly stand.
I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.
I had stopped talking to a very close friend of mine. A week later he came over to try and make friends with me again and from the way he talked I felt that he was a very mean person.
When I accepted Jesus Christ as my saviour.
When I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus
column2: full of passengers
column3: nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road. a

column1: When my sister came home late one day and thus disobeyed my parents.

The first time that I saw a dead person. This was when I started my gross anatomy practicals.

column1: During my childhood

I have not felt this emotion in my life.
I have not felt this emotion in my life.

English papers are due on Friday. They are returned on Tuesday. This Tuesday I was afraid to go to class and get my paper because I knew it was bad.
A friend of mine came to visit and stayed with my roommate and me. a My roommate and I became good friends. After she left
column2: he didn't talk too highly of her.

column3: people were injured but not seriously.

column1: When seeing a friend that I had not seen in a long while.

column2: but the result wasn't what I had expected.

I neglected some work that had to be done around the house and a telling my roommate I would get it done.
Achieving my goal at a swim meet. I worked toward the goal for 9 a yrs. I was capable of achieving it
column2: but I didn't know when.

column1: Housesitting and hearing the alarm go off. I knew someone had to be breaking in. I called the police and was panicking while on the phone. It was awful. It turns out that I stepped on the hidden alarm without prior knowledge of its existence.

Going to Cowell Hospital and finding out tediously that I had a stress fracture. The anger came when the senile doctors found out 4 weeks later that I had 2 stress fractures in one foot and should have had crutches. I was in distinct pain and barely could walk to classes. They said it would be better in 2 weeks.
Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally and cried for 6 hours off and on. I wanted to hide away and did for a few days.
Seeing a friend making love to a high school girl. I accidentally was dragged into this room where the happenings had occurred. I was disgusted at the reality.
I borrowed a gold bracelet without the girl's knowledge. I had it for so long that I had to keep it. To this day I feel ashamed of myself for having it. I never wear the thing anymore.

After moving out of my apt. I took all the furniture and dishes and everything. It was mine but I took it all just to spite my roomies. We had a few (a lot) disagreements. I felt guilty for moving out for bad reasons.
It was the weekend of my homecoming. I saw my sister for the first time in 3 months. She's my best friend and extremely close.
After my shoulder operation
column2: I woke up in the hospital room alone. I was in pain and was still under heavy medications. I could not find my parents.

column1: When I found out my cousin had been killed. I was angry at the world and her murderer who was her ex-boyfriend. It was the worst and most hateful day of my life.

column2: I boarded the plane. It was the hardest thing to do and it was a sad trip home.

column1: I was supposed to be studying for my math midterm a few days ago
column2: however
column3: I fooled around with my roommate and didn't start studying until midnight. I was disgusted with myself.

column1: Since I've been here I haven't written to any of my relatives. I got a letter from my mom telling me how upset my grandparents are from not hearing from me.
I got an A in anatomy - the first one I have ever gotten in a science class here.
A man in a car was following me when I went running early one morning in a fairly secluded area.
I caught a peeping tom at my window when I was getting undressed.
Saying goodbye at the airport to my boyfriend who has to go to a school back East. We are very close and have been together for 4 years.
My parents claimed me on their income tax after I had been out of a house for two years receiving no financial support from them. As result
column2: I had to work more during school because they were expected by the FAO to contribute to my education when they refuse to do so.

column1: I was wearing a short skirt one day and someone told me my underwear was showing.
Getting a D in a class last semester and knowing it was because I didn't study.
Went to a movie with a date

column1: At age 10 my foster grandmother died
column2: and I had a fear of dying.

The girl I was seeing didn't want to have a serious relationship. a

Death of a pet rabbit. We had to give it away because my brother became allergic to it. We gave it to a man who kept animals and lots of other animals for children to watch. We went to visit our rabbit. It was badly beaten by the other rabbits and eventually
column2: died.

column1: When I stand at the bus stop for one hour waiting for the bus to arrive.

At a party in which I met an interesting female. We enjoyed each other's company

column2: Halloween

After days or weekends where I did not accomplish the amount of studying that I wanted to because of more pleasant activities which come up.

column2: I'm the oldest) wouldn't hold together. Everything turned out fine.

column1: Last semester when I dated a girl whom I've known for almost a year. However one night she said she wanted us to be just friends. I confided this to a friend Jim I was suffering. a month or two later he broke up with his old girlfriend and they started going out regularly. I have no girlfriend nor have I had a romantic relationship of any significance. I feel some anger about us being friends again.

When I was a Sr. in HS. one of the class counsellors died of hepatitis. She was very sensitive. She knew my shyness and drew me out to improve my image. I missed her funeral - so I could not publically grieve. My parents didn't understand.

I applied for a job as a GALSO counsellor and I made the strongest possible application but was denied an interview. I felt disgusted at the system which by promoting the cause of minorities makes employing whites the lowest priority.

I was angry about 3 months ago and I kicked back against the wall. It caved in and so I had to show it to my parents. I had been angry after my mother said something to me about not being able to find clothes in my size - something that I'm sensitive about. (6' 5'' 210)
When I lied last week. I lied to someone to get info. for a paper
column2: I was writing. I told her the info. was for a newspaper article. I was afraid if I told the truth she wouldn't help me.

column1: Someone (a boy) paid special attention to me.

column1: I saw part of a Prince video with him crawling out of a bathtub.

When people would tell me that my ex-girlfriend was playing around with me.

When I was 10

column1: When I copy someone else's problem set.
I got a very good grade on one of my midterms a few weeks ago.

My mom called early in the morning (On a Monday) and I had just seen her that weekend. I couldn't understand what could be so important as to make her call at such a strange hour. I missed a call and had to call her back that afternoon.
My peers didn't want me to meet someone during the rush for fear that I would give her a bad outlook on our sorority house. I shouldn't have seen this
column2: but they blew and I did.

column1: I was told that a friend of a friend committed suicide.
Doing poorly on a midterm.
My boat didn't win a race that we were favoured to win.
Sleeping through crew practice on Monday morning.

When I had achieved a goal indirectly. I work for CAL Football and our 2nd win of the season was very gratifying and brought us joy because of the hard work involved and the fact that no one expected we would win.

Upon reading a story on a serial killer by the name of Henry Lee a Lucas who has been given the distinction of killing more people a that any other man. I began to wonder if I should take more care of my safety.
I had worked long and hard on a project when a friend inadvertently destroyed it. I could not forgive him for a long time. And at times still get angry at him.
When a pet died. The pet was the closest friend I had for 15 years.
When people/press analyze a particular newsworthy item (CAL a Football team) I am a member and can only see the situation in a bad light and always put the team down.
Recently
column2: some friends and I had too much to drink while on a football road trip to USC. We trashed our hotel room and I felt ashamed when the maid walked in the next morning.

column1: I felt guilty when I mislead a person into thinking he was a close friend when that person was more of a casual acquaintance.
Getting my acceptance letter from CAL.

One summer when I was camping with friends they devised an elaborate plan to scare me by having our camp attacked by a wild animal (one of them) and then convincing me the campground was a home of a satanic organization.
I went out dancing and found my boyfriend kissing another girl.
At the end of my senior yr. in high school
column2: I found out that a friend of mine I knew had cancer had been diagnosed as terminally ill.

column1: Sitting in the dorm when the guys were verbally reading letters in Penthouse.
I slipped on butter one evening in the Dining Commons and landed on my rear causing my tray also to land on the floor.
A person I was attracted to walked me home in the rain and got sick.
Today I did a lot better on my architecture project than I expected.
When I was little I lost control of my bike and started to go into a busy intersection but my neighbour stopped me just in time.
This summer I got into a fight with one of our patrons (at a theatre). He hit me and I hit him and her friend
column2: he hit my friend and we all hit each other.

When I found out the CIA was mining Nicaraguan harbours.
A month ago I turned in an English paper late after I had already had a previous paper late and promised not to do it again.
I forgot my mother's and sister's birthdays (they fall on the same day).
When I received a letter of acceptance to CAL.

When someone told a secret I told them not to tell.
When my mother was very sick and almost died.

When I failed some tests in my first year at CAL.
When I stole something.
I gave my mom a gift she wanted for years. I reflected on her joy.
Walking through campus at night a squirrel jumped in front of me.

After a long trip in my dad's van without incident I stopped to fill the tank with gas and dented the side of the van against the pole. Then my car's electrical system would not work when I tried to drive home from his house.
At one point in a relationship
column2: my boyfriend was seeing an old flame more than me. At our confrontation tears were shed.

column1: When a skunk invaded the camp.
I made an unkind remark about the ethnicity of some friends without realizing it.

I mangled the side of my dad's van on a fence. I did not realize the extent of the damage until he showed it to me the next day. The shock on my face was genuine so a friend interceded with a good excuse which I did not deny. I never clarified the situation.
When I finally got a job after days of wondering whether I would be hired or not and counting on the money that it would bring.
When I had to walk home in the dark for the first time.
A time when
column2: as part of my work
column3: I was sent out actually sort of a volunteered to run an errand for someone who had no authority to send me out and the address was very far
column4: especially on foot and a turned out to be incorrect too. The whole trip was a waste.

column1: When my boyfriend said he did not want to see me anymore (which turned out to be untrue).
When my roommate forgets to flush the toilet.
When I did poorly on a test and I knew that there wasn't an excuse for not doing better. Made mistakes I could not believe I a made.

Remembering (at the time I did not feel guilt) in recent yrs. how angry I would get when I was babysitting my new brother and he would not stop crying. I did not do anything harmful or shocking. a But I feel guilty for treating him the way I did especially a since I adore him now. That's why I spoil him now.
Yesterday when I received a B on a history midterm. I felt overjoyed after having received C's previously.
When I began school at UC. The pre-enrollment the classes
column2: and the question of success scared me.

column1: A month ago when one of my fellow workers got a promotion over me. It was just a small promotion but recognition was involved.
When another fellow worker decided to leave the company. We had been very close and we would not be able to work with each other any longer.
Through the media and their presentation of a kidnapped child who was raped.
When I had not been accepted to a college which I dreamed of going to. I felt that I had let myself and my parents down.
I told my parents (or more realistically) would not do what they wanted me to do anymore. I guess I sort of betrayed them after all they had done for me.
When I drove partially across the country with my father. We stopped in a few towns and stayed overnight in motels. The joy I got was from the freedom I felt and the real beauty of the country.
One day before Christmas
column2: I went shopping with my brother and his friend. We had a good time. But on the way home we were almost in an accident because the weather was bad.

column1: I can't remember being truly angry. Usually
column2: it's just a disappointment that I feel. One situation would be with my brother. He and I used to be close but now he seems to be avoiding me.

column2: I realized how much my friends cared for me. When we left and for a long time after that I was very sad.

column1: Once when I was babysitting for some neighbour's children I found a roach in the bathroom. I had never seen a roach before but I called my mother to make sure that's what they were. And she came over and checked.
The first time I slept at my boyfriend's house and had to walk a down the hall to the shower in front of his housemates. I felt they were judging me.
I was at school and afterwards went to work. After work
column2: I went to see a friend and stayed out late. when I got home my mother was awake and I felt guilty.

column1: The last time I had sex.
after getting a fail notice for a math class

Hearing about a friend back home that had to have his stomach pumped because he had overdosed on pills.
After learning on the news about this man who killed more than 300 women and habitually copulated into their inert bodies.
I had just masturbated with another boy.
Going out with another girl besides my girlfriend and not telling her.

When a close friend did not write.
Leaving high school.

Not noticing my roommate's quietness or signs of discomfort.
I went home and visited with my family and friends.

I was playing a sport in an advanced PE class and many of the people were not advanced.
I bought a possible answer to a homework problem which was completely inapplicable to the question due to my not having read about the subject matter.
Lately
column2: I've felt guilty because I'm falling behind in my classes and not studying much.

Waiting for my girlfriend to come from her apt. to mine. She was very late and I thought something awful had happened.
I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move on it. I tried to fix it but could not.
Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England and an I had not seen him for 10 years.
Cleaning the bathroom of my apt. and realised my roommate who had lived there all summer by himself had never cleaned the place.
